title.en: House of Duke Tai of Qi
title.raw: 《齊太公世家》 House of Duke Tai of Qi

sentences.zh: 太公望呂尚者，東海上人。

translations.literal: Tai Gong Wang Lü Shang, eastern sea person.
translations.idiomatic: Tai Gong Wang Lü Shang was a man from the eastern seaboard.

sentences.zh: 其先祖嘗為四嶽，佐禹平水土甚有功。

translations.literal: His ancestors once were four peaks, assisted Yu pacify water earth very had merit.
translations.idiomatic: His ancestors had once been the Four Peaks; they assisted Yu in pacifying the waters and earth; they had very great merit.

sentences.zh: 虞夏之際封於呂，或封於申，姓姜氏。

translations.literal: Yu Xia between enfeoffed at Lü, or enfeoffed at Shen, surname Jiang clan.
translations.idiomatic: In the time between Yu and Xia, they were enfeoffed at Lü; or enfeoffed at Shen; surname Jiang clan.

sentences.zh: 夏商之時，申、呂或封枝庶子孫，或為庶人，尚其後苗裔也。

translations.literal: Xia Shang time, Shen, Lü or enfeoffed branch cadet descendants, or became commoners, Shang their later progeny also.
translations.idiomatic: In Xia and Shang times, Shen and Lü sometimes enfeoffed branch and cadet descendants; or they became commoners; Shang was their later progeny.

sentences.zh: 本姓姜氏，從其封姓，故曰呂尚。

translations.literal: Originally surname Jiang clan, followed their enfeoffment surname, therefore called Lü Shang.
translations.idiomatic: Originally of the Jiang surname clan; followed their enfeoffment surname; therefore called Lü Shang.

sentences.zh: 呂尚蓋嘗窮困，年老矣，以漁釣奸周西伯。

translations.literal: Lü Shang probably once poor distressed, year old already, with fishing angling deceived Zhou Xi Bo.
translations.idiomatic: Lü Shang had probably once been poor and distressed; he was already old; with fishing and angling he deceived Zhou Xi Bo.

sentences.zh: 西伯將出獵，卜之，曰「所獲非龍非彨非虎非羆；

translations.literal: Xi Bo about to go hunt, divined it, said 'what obtained not dragon not boar not tiger not bear;
translations.idiomatic: Xi Bo was about to go hunting; he divined it; said 'what will be obtained is not a dragon, not a boar, not a tiger, not a bear;

sentences.zh: 所獲霸王之輔」。

translations.literal: what obtained hegemon king assistant'.
translations.idiomatic: what will be obtained is a hegemon king's assistant.'

sentences.zh: 於是周西伯獵，果遇太公於渭之陽，與語大說，曰：「自吾先君太公曰『當有聖人適周，周以興』。

translations.literal: Therefore Zhou Xi Bo hunted, indeed met Tai Gong at Wei river yang, spoke with greatly pleased, said: 'From my late lord Tai Gong said "should have sage person come Zhou, Zhou thereby rise".'
translations.idiomatic: Therefore Zhou Xi Bo went hunting; indeed met Tai Gong at the northern bank of the Wei River; spoke with him and was greatly pleased; said: 'From my late lord Tai Gong who said "there should be a sage who comes to Zhou, Zhou will thereby rise".'

sentences.zh: 子真是邪？

translations.literal: You truly this?'
translations.idiomatic: Are you truly this person?'

sentences.zh: 吾太公望子久矣。」

translations.literal: I Tai Gong hoped for you long already.'
translations.idiomatic: I, Tai Gong, have hoped for you for a long time.'

sentences.zh: 故號之曰「太公望」，載與俱歸，立為師。

translations.literal: Therefore named him "Tai Gong Wang", loaded with together returned, established as teacher.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore they named him 'Tai Gong Wang'; loaded him and together returned; established him as teacher.

sentences.zh: 或曰，太公博聞，嘗事紂。

translations.literal: Some said, Tai Gong broad knowledge, once served Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: Some say that Tai Gong was broadly knowledgeable; he once served Zhou.

sentences.zh: 紂無道，去之。

translations.literal: Zhou without way, left him.
translations.idiomatic: Zhou was without the Way; he left him.

sentences.zh: 游說諸侯，無所遇，而卒西歸周西伯。

translations.literal: Wandered persuaded feudal lords, nowhere met, and finally west returned Zhou Xi Bo.
translations.idiomatic: He wandered and persuaded the feudal lords; nowhere was he met; and finally he west returned to Zhou Xi Bo.

sentences.zh: 或曰，呂尚處士，隱海濱。

translations.literal: Some said, Lü Shang recluse scholar, hidden seashore.
translations.idiomatic: Some say that Lü Shang was a recluse scholar; hidden at the seashore.

sentences.zh: 周西伯拘羑里，散宜生、閎夭素知而招呂尚。

translations.literal: Zhou Xi Bo imprisoned You Li, San Yi Sheng, Hong Yao long knew and recruited Lü Shang.
translations.idiomatic: Zhou Xi Bo was imprisoned at You Li; San Yi Sheng and Hong Yao had long known and recruited Lü Shang.

sentences.zh: 呂尚亦曰「吾聞西伯賢，又善養老，盍往焉」。

translations.literal: Lü Shang also said 'I heard Xi Bo worthy, moreover good at nourishing old, why not go there'.
translations.idiomatic: Lü Shang also said 'I heard Xi Bo is worthy; moreover good at nourishing the old; why not go there.'

sentences.zh: 三人者為西伯求美女奇物，獻之於紂，以贖西伯。

translations.literal: Three persons for Xi Bo sought beautiful women rare objects, presented them to Zhou, to redeem Xi Bo.
translations.idiomatic: The three persons sought beautiful women and rare objects for Xi Bo; presented them to Zhou; to redeem Xi Bo.

sentences.zh: 西伯得以出，反國。

translations.literal: Xi Bo able to come out, returned state.
translations.idiomatic: Xi Bo was able to come out; returned to his state.

sentences.zh: 言呂尚所以事周雖異，然要之為文武師。

translations.literal: Speaking Lü Shang reason served Zhou though different, yet essential was Wen Wu teacher.
translations.idiomatic: Speaking of Lü Shang's reason for serving Zhou though different accounts exist; yet essentially he was Wen and Wu's teacher.

sentences.zh: 周西伯昌之脫羑里歸，與呂尚陰謀修德以傾商政，其事多兵權與奇計，故後世之言兵及周之陰權皆宗太公為本謀。

translations.literal: Zhou Xi Bo Chang escaped You Li returned, with Lü Shang secretly plotted cultivated virtue to overthrow Shang government, their affairs many military authority and strange plans, therefore later generations speaking military and Zhou secret authority all revered Tai Gong as original strategy.
translations.idiomatic: When Zhou Xi Bo Chang escaped You Li and returned; with Lü Shang he secretly plotted to cultivate virtue to overthrow the Shang government; their affairs involved much military authority and strange plans; therefore later generations' discussions of military matters and Zhou's secret authority all revered Tai Gong as the original strategist.

sentences.zh: 周西伯政平，及斷虞芮之訟，而詩人稱西伯受命曰文王。

translations.literal: Zhou Xi Bo government peaceful, and judged Yu Rui dispute, and poets called Xi Bo received mandate called Wen Wang.
translations.idiomatic: Zhou Xi Bo's government was peaceful; and he judged the Yu and Rui dispute; and poets called Xi Bo who received the mandate 'Wen Wang.'

sentences.zh: 伐崇、密須、犬夷，大作豐邑。

translations.literal: Attacked Chong, Mi Xu, Quan Yi, greatly built Feng city.
translations.idiomatic: He attacked Chong, Mi Xu, and Quan Yi; greatly built Feng city.

sentences.zh: 天下三分，其二歸周者，太公之謀計居多。

translations.literal: World three divided, its two returned Zhou, Tai Gong strategy plans resided many.
translations.idiomatic: The world was three parts divided; two of them returned to Zhou; Tai Gong's strategies and plans were the majority.

sentences.zh: 文王崩，武王即位。

translations.literal: Wen Wang collapsed, Wu Wang ascended throne.
translations.idiomatic: Wen Wang passed away; Wu Wang ascended the throne.

sentences.zh: 九年，欲修文王業，東伐以觀諸侯集否。

translations.literal: Ninth year, wanted to continue Wen Wang enterprise, east attacked to observe feudal lords gathered or not.
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth year, he wanted to continue Wen Wang's enterprise; east attacked to observe whether the feudal lords gathered or not.

sentences.zh: 師行，師尚父左杖黃鉞，右把白旄以誓，曰：「蒼兕蒼兕，總爾眾庶，與爾舟楫，後至者斬！」

translations.literal: Army marched, Shi Shang Fu left held yellow axe, right grasped white banner to swear, said: 'Blue rhinoceros blue rhinoceros, gather your multitudes, give you boats oars, later arrive chop!'
translations.idiomatic: The army marched; Shi Shang Fu left held the yellow axe, right grasped the white banner to swear, said: 'Blue rhinoceros! Blue rhinoceros! Gather your multitudes; I give you boats and oars; those who arrive later will be chopped!'

sentences.zh: 遂至盟津。

translations.literal: Then arrived Meng Jin.
translations.idiomatic: Then they arrived at Meng Jin.

sentences.zh: 諸侯不期而會者八百諸侯。

translations.literal: Feudal lords not appointed met eight hundred feudal lords.
translations.idiomatic: The feudal lords who met without appointment numbered eight hundred feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 諸侯皆曰：「紂可伐也。」

translations.literal: Feudal lords all said: 'Zhou can attack also.'
translations.idiomatic: The feudal lords all said: 'Zhou can be attacked.'

sentences.zh: 武王曰：「未可。」

translations.literal: Wu Wang said: 'Not yet possible.'
translations.idiomatic: Wu Wang said: 'Not yet possible.'

sentences.zh: 還師，與太公作此太誓。

translations.literal: Returned army, with Tai Gong made this great oath.
translations.idiomatic: They returned the army; with Tai Gong made this great oath.

sentences.zh: 居二年，紂殺王子比干，囚箕子。

translations.literal: Resided two years, Zhou killed Wang Zi Bi Gan, imprisoned Ji Zi.
translations.idiomatic: Two years passed; Zhou killed Wang Zi Bi Gan; imprisoned Ji Zi.

sentences.zh: 武王將伐紂，卜龜兆，不吉，風雨暴至。

translations.literal: Wu Wang about to attack Zhou, divined turtle omen, not auspicious, wind rain violently arrived.
translations.idiomatic: Wu Wang was about to attack Zhou; divined the turtle omen; not auspicious; wind and rain arrived violently.

sentences.zh: 群公盡懼，唯太公彊之勸武王，武王於是遂行。

translations.literal: Group dukes all feared, only Tai Gong strongly urged Wu Wang, Wu Wang therefore then proceeded.
translations.idiomatic: The group of dukes all feared; only Tai Gong strongly urged Wu Wang; Wu Wang therefore then proceeded.

sentences.zh: 十一年正月甲子，誓於牧野，伐商紂。

translations.literal: Eleventh year first month Jia Zi, swore at Mu Ye, attacked Shang Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh year first month on Jia Zi; swore at Mu Ye; attacked Shang Zhou.

sentences.zh: 紂師敗績。

translations.literal: Zhou army defeated routed.
translations.idiomatic: Zhou's army was defeated and routed.

sentences.zh: 紂反走，登鹿臺，遂追斬紂。

translations.literal: Zhou turned fled, ascended Lu Tai, then pursued beheaded Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: Zhou turned and fled; ascended Lu Tai; then they pursued and beheaded Zhou.

sentences.zh: 明日，武王立于社，群公奉明水，衛康叔封布采席，師尚父牽牲，史佚策祝，以告神討紂之罪。

translations.literal: Next day, Wu Wang stood at She altar, group dukes presented clear water, Wei Kang Shu spread mat colored mat, Shi Shang Fu led sacrificial animal, Shi Yi wrote prayer, to tell spirits punish Zhou crime.
translations.idiomatic: The next day, Wu Wang stood at the She altar; the group of dukes presented clear water; Wei Kang Shu spread the mat and colored mat; Shi Shang Fu led the sacrificial animal; Shi Yi wrote the prayer; to tell the spirits to punish Zhou's crime.

sentences.zh: 散鹿臺之錢，發鉅橋之粟，以振貧民。

translations.literal: Scattered Lu Tai money, opened Ju Qiao grain, to relieve poor people.
translations.idiomatic: They scattered Lu Tai's money; opened Ju Qiao's grain; to relieve the poor people.

sentences.zh: 封比干墓，釋箕子囚。

translations.literal: Sealed Bi Gan tomb, released Ji Zi prisoner.
translations.idiomatic: They sealed Bi Gan's tomb; released Ji Zi the prisoner.

sentences.zh: 遷九鼎，修周政，與天下更始。

translations.literal: Moved nine tripods, repaired Zhou government, with world renewed beginning.
translations.idiomatic: They moved the nine tripods; repaired Zhou government; with the world began anew.

sentences.zh: 師尚父謀居多。

translations.literal: Shi Shang Fu strategy resided many.
translations.idiomatic: Shi Shang Fu's strategies were the majority.

sentences.zh: 於是武王已平商而王天下，封師尚父於齊營丘。

translations.literal: Therefore Wu Wang already pacified Shang and king world, enfeoffed Shi Shang Fu at Qi Ying Qiu.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore Wu Wang had already pacified Shang and became king of the world; enfeoffed Shi Shang Fu at Qi Ying Qiu.

sentences.zh: 東就國，道宿行遲。

translations.literal: East went to state, road lodged walked slowly.
translations.idiomatic: He went east to his state; lodged on the road and walked slowly.

sentences.zh: 逆旅之人曰：「吾聞時難得而易失。

translations.literal: Inn person said: 'I heard opportunity difficult obtain and easy lose.'
translations.idiomatic: The inn person said: 'I heard that opportunity is difficult to obtain and easy to lose.'

sentences.zh: 客寢甚安，殆非就國者也。」

translations.literal: Guest slept very peacefully, probably not go to state person also.'
translations.idiomatic: The guest slept very peacefully; probably not a person going to his state.'

sentences.zh: 太公聞之，夜衣而行，犁明至國。

translations.literal: Tai Gong heard this, night clothed and went, at dawn arrived state.
translations.idiomatic: Tai Gong heard this; clothed at night and went; at dawn arrived at the state.

sentences.zh: 萊侯來伐，與之爭營丘。

translations.literal: Lai Hou came attacked, with him contended Ying Qiu.
translations.idiomatic: Lai Hou came to attack; contended with him over Ying Qiu.

sentences.zh: 營丘邊萊。

translations.literal: Ying Qiu bordered Lai.
translations.idiomatic: Ying Qiu bordered Lai.

sentences.zh: 萊人，夷也，會紂之亂而周初定，未能集遠方，是以與太公爭國。

translations.literal: Lai people, Yi also, met Zhou chaos and Zhou initially settled, not yet able gather distant regions, therefore with Tai Gong contended state.
translations.idiomatic: The Lai people were Yi barbarians; met Zhou's chaos and Zhou was initially settled; not yet able to gather distant regions; therefore contended with Tai Gong over the state.

sentences.zh: 太公至國，修政，因其俗，簡其禮，通商工之業，便魚鹽之利，而人民多歸齊，齊為大國。

translations.literal: Tai Gong arrived state, repaired government, followed their customs, simplified their rites, opened merchant artisan occupations, facilitated fish salt profits, and people many returned Qi, Qi became great state.
translations.idiomatic: Tai Gong arrived at the state; repaired the government; followed their customs; simplified their rites; opened merchant and artisan occupations; facilitated fish and salt profits; and many people returned to Qi; Qi became a great state.

sentences.zh: 及周成王少時，管蔡作亂，淮夷畔周，乃使召康公命太公曰：「東至海，西至河，南至穆陵，北至無棣，五侯九伯，實得征之。」

translations.literal: And Zhou Cheng Wang young time, Guan Cai made rebellion, Huai Yi rebelled Zhou, then sent Zhao Kang Gong commanded Tai Gong said: 'East to sea, west to river, south to Mu Ling, north to Wu Di, five marquises nine earls, truly can campaign them.'
translations.idiomatic: And when Zhou Cheng Wang was young; Guan and Cai made rebellion; Huai Yi rebelled against Zhou; then they sent Zhao Kang Gong to command Tai Gong saying: 'East to the sea, west to the river, south to Mu Ling, north to Wu Di, five marquises and nine earls, truly can campaign against them.'

sentences.zh: 齊由此得征伐，為大國。

translations.literal: Qi thereby got to campaign, became great state.
translations.idiomatic: Qi thereby got to campaign; became a great state.

sentences.zh: 都營丘。

translations.literal: Capital Ying Qiu.
translations.idiomatic: The capital was Ying Qiu.

sentences.zh: 蓋太公之卒百有餘年，子丁公呂伋立。

translations.literal: Probably Tai Gong died over one hundred years, son Ding Gong Lü Ji established.
translations.idiomatic: Probably over one hundred years after Tai Gong's death; his son Ding Gong Lü Ji was established.

sentences.zh: 丁公卒，子乙公得立。

translations.literal: Ding Gong died, son Yi Gong De established.
translations.idiomatic: Ding Gong died; his son Yi Gong De was established.

sentences.zh: 乙公卒，子癸公慈母立。

translations.literal: Yi Gong died, son Gui Gong Ci Mu established.
translations.idiomatic: Yi Gong died; his son Gui Gong Ci Mu was established.

sentences.zh: 癸公卒，子哀公不辰立。

translations.literal: Gui Gong died, son Ai Gong Bu Chen established.
translations.idiomatic: Gui Gong died; his son Ai Gong Bu Chen was established.

sentences.zh: 哀公時，紀侯譖之周，周烹哀公而立其弟靜，是為胡公。

translations.literal: Ai Gong time, Ji Hou slandered him to Zhou, Zhou boiled Ai Gong and established his younger brother Jing, this was Hu Gong.
translations.idiomatic: During Ai Gong's time, Ji Hou slandered him to Zhou; Zhou boiled Ai Gong and established his younger brother Jing; this was Hu Gong.

sentences.zh: 胡公徙都薄泵，而當周夷王之時。

translations.literal: Hu Gong moved capital Bo Bei, and met Zhou Yi Wang time.
translations.idiomatic: Hu Gong moved the capital to Bo Bei; and it was during Zhou Yi Wang's time.

sentences.zh: 哀公之同母少弟山怨胡公，乃與其黨率營丘人襲攻殺胡公而自立，是為獻公。

translations.literal: Ai Gong same mother younger brother Shan resented Hu Gong, then with his faction led Ying Qiu people surprise attacked killed Hu Gong and self established, this was Xian Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Ai Gong's same-mother younger brother Shan resented Hu Gong; then with his faction led Ying Qiu people to surprise attack and kill Hu Gong and self-establish; this was Xian Gong.

sentences.zh: 獻公元年，盡逐胡公子，因徙薄泵都，治臨菑。

translations.literal: Xian Gong first year, completely expelled Hu Gong sons, therefore moved Bo Bei capital, governed Lin Zi.
translations.idiomatic: In Xian Gong's first year, he completely expelled Hu Gong's sons; therefore moved the Bo Bei capital; governed Lin Zi.

sentences.zh: 九年，獻公卒，子武公壽立。

translations.literal: Ninth year, Xian Gong died, son Wu Gong Shou established.
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth year, Xian Gong died; his son Wu Gong Shou was established.

sentences.zh: 武公九年，周厲王出奔，居彘。

translations.literal: Wu Gong ninth year, Zhou Li Wang fled, resided Zhi.
translations.idiomatic: In Wu Gong's ninth year, Zhou Li Wang fled; resided at Zhi.

sentences.zh: 十年，王室亂，大臣行政，號曰「共和」。

translations.literal: Tenth year, royal house chaotic, ministers administered government, called 'Gong He'.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth year, the royal house was chaotic; ministers administered the government; it was called 'Gong He'.

sentences.zh: 二十四年，周宣王初立。

translations.literal: Twenty-fourth year, Zhou Xuan Wang initially established.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-fourth year, Zhou Xuan Wang was initially established.

sentences.zh: 二十六年，武公卒，子厲公無忌立。

translations.literal: Twenty-sixth year, Wu Gong died, son Li Gong Wu Ji established.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-sixth year, Wu Gong died; his son Li Gong Wu Ji was established.

sentences.zh: 厲公暴虐，故胡公子復入齊，齊人欲立之，乃與攻殺厲公。

translations.literal: Li Gong tyrannical cruel, therefore Hu Gong son again entered Qi, Qi people wanted to establish him, then with attacked killed Li Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Li Gong was tyrannical and cruel; therefore Hu Gong's son again entered Qi; Qi people wanted to establish him; then together attacked and killed Li Gong.

sentences.zh: 胡公子亦戰死。

translations.literal: Hu Gong son also battle died.
translations.idiomatic: Hu Gong's son also died in battle.

sentences.zh: 齊人乃立厲公子赤為君，是為文公，而誅殺厲公者七十人。

translations.literal: Qi people then established Li Gong son Chi as lord, this was Wen Gong, and executed killed Li Gong persons seventy.
translations.idiomatic: Qi people then established Li Gong's son Chi as lord; this was Wen Gong; and executed seventy persons who had killed Li Gong.

sentences.zh: 文公十二年卒，子成公脫立。

translations.literal: Wen Gong twelfth year died, son Cheng Gong Tuo established.
translations.idiomatic: Wen Gong died in the twelfth year; his son Cheng Gong Tuo was established.

sentences.zh: 成公九年卒，子莊公購立。

translations.literal: Cheng Gong ninth year died, son Zhuang Gong Gou established.
translations.idiomatic: Cheng Gong died in the ninth year; his son Zhuang Gong Gou was established.

sentences.zh: 莊公二十四年，犬戎殺幽王，周東徙雒。

translations.literal: Zhuang Gong twenty-fourth year, Quan Rong killed You Wang, Zhou east moved Luo.
translations.idiomatic: In Zhuang Gong's twenty-fourth year, Quan Rong killed You Wang; Zhou moved east to Luo.

sentences.zh: 秦始列為諸侯。

translations.literal: Qin began ranked as feudal lords.
translations.idiomatic: Qin began to be ranked among the feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 五十六年，晉弒其君昭侯。

translations.literal: Fifty-sixth year, Jin assassinated their lord Zhao Hou.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifty-sixth year, Jin assassinated their lord Zhao Hou.

sentences.zh: 六十四年，莊公卒，子釐公祿甫立。

translations.literal: Sixty-fourth year, Zhuang Gong died, son Xi Gong Lu Fu established.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixty-fourth year, Zhuang Gong died; his son Xi Gong Lu Fu was established.

sentences.zh: 釐公九年，魯隱公初立。

translations.literal: Xi Gong ninth year, Lu Yin Gong initially established.
translations.idiomatic: In Xi Gong's ninth year, Lu Yin Gong was initially established.

sentences.zh: 十九年，魯桓公弒其兄隱公而自立為君。

translations.literal: Nineteenth year, Lu Huan Gong assassinated his elder brother Yin Gong and self established as lord.
translations.idiomatic: In the nineteenth year, Lu Huan Gong assassinated his elder brother Yin Gong and established himself as lord.

sentences.zh: 二十五年，北戎伐齊。

translations.literal: Twenty-fifth year, northern Rong attacked Qi.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-fifth year, northern Rong attacked Qi.

sentences.zh: 鄭使太子忽來救齊，齊欲妻之。

translations.literal: Zheng sent crown prince Hu to save Qi, Qi wanted to marry him.
translations.idiomatic: Zheng sent crown prince Hu to save Qi; Qi wanted to marry him to their daughter.

sentences.zh: 忽曰：「鄭小齊大，非我敵。」

translations.literal: Hu said: 'Zheng small Qi big, not my match.'
translations.idiomatic: Hu said: 'Zheng is small and Qi is big; they are not my match.'

sentences.zh: 遂辭之。

translations.literal: Then declined it.
translations.idiomatic: He then declined it.

sentences.zh: 三十二年，釐公同母弟夷仲年死。

translations.literal: Thirty-second year, Xi Gong same mother younger brother Yi Zhong year died.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-second year, Xi Gong's same-mother younger brother Yi Zhong died in that year.

sentences.zh: 其子曰公孫無知，釐公愛之，令其秩服奉養比太子。

translations.literal: His son called Gong Sun Wu Zhi, Xi Gong loved him, ordered his rank clothing support compare to crown prince.
translations.idiomatic: His son was called Gong Sun Wu Zhi; Xi Gong loved him; ordered his rank, clothing, and support to be comparable to the crown prince.

sentences.zh: 三十三年，釐公卒，太子諸兒立，是為襄公。

translations.literal: Thirty-third year, Xi Gong died, crown prince Zhu Er established, this was Xiang Gong.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-third year, Xi Gong died; crown prince Zhu Er was established; this was Xiang Gong.

sentences.zh: 襄公元年，始為太子時，嘗與無知鬬，及立，絀無知秩服，無知怨。

translations.literal: Xiang Gong first year, when began as crown prince time, once with Wu Zhi fought, and established, reduced Wu Zhi rank clothing, Wu Zhi resented.
translations.idiomatic: In Xiang Gong's first year, when he first became crown prince, he once fought with Wu Zhi; when established as ruler, he reduced Wu Zhi's rank and clothing; Wu Zhi resented this.

sentences.zh: 四年，魯桓公與夫人如齊。

translations.literal: Fourth year, Lu Huan Gong with consort went to Qi.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth year, Lu Huan Gong went to Qi with his consort.

sentences.zh: 齊襄公故嘗私通魯夫人。

translations.literal: Qi Xiang Gong therefore once privately communicated with Lu consort.
translations.idiomatic: Qi Xiang Gong therefore once had private relations with the Lu consort.

sentences.zh: 魯夫人者，襄公女弟也，自釐公時嫁為魯桓公婦，及桓公來而襄公復通焉。

translations.literal: Lu consort, Xiang Gong younger sister also, from Xi Gong time married as Lu Huan Gong wife, and Huan Gong came and Xiang Gong again communicated with her.
translations.idiomatic: The Lu consort was Xiang Gong's younger sister; from Xi Gong's time she was married as Lu Huan Gong's wife; when Huan Gong came, Xiang Gong again had relations with her.

sentences.zh: 魯桓公知之，怒夫人，夫人以告齊襄公。

translations.literal: Lu Huan Gong knew this, angered consort, consort told Qi Xiang Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Lu Huan Gong knew this; he was angry at the consort; the consort told Qi Xiang Gong.

sentences.zh: 齊襄公與魯君飲，醉之，使力士彭生抱上魯君車，因拉殺魯桓公，桓公下車則死矣。

translations.literal: Qi Xiang Gong with Lu lord drank, intoxicated him, made strong man Peng Sheng embrace carry Lu lord chariot, then pulled killed Lu Huan Gong, Huan Gong descended chariot then died.
translations.idiomatic: Qi Xiang Gong drank with the Lu lord; intoxicated him; made the strong man Peng Sheng embrace and carry him onto the Lu lord's chariot; then pulled and killed Lu Huan Gong; Huan Gong had just descended from the chariot when he died.

sentences.zh: 魯人以為讓，而齊襄公殺彭生以謝魯。

translations.literal: Lu people considered it a reproach, and Qi Xiang Gong killed Peng Sheng to apologize to Lu.
translations.idiomatic: Lu people considered it a reproach; Qi Xiang Gong killed Peng Sheng to apologize to Lu.

sentences.zh: 八年，伐紀，紀遷去其邑。

translations.literal: Eighth year, attacked Ji, Ji moved away their city.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighth year, attacked Ji; Ji moved away from their city.

sentences.zh: 十二年，初，襄公使連稱、管至父戍葵丘，瓜時而往，及瓜而代。

translations.literal: Twelfth year, initially, Xiang Gong sent Lian Cheng, Guan Zhi Fu garrison Kui Qiu, melon time went, and melon time replaced.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth year, initially, Xiang Gong sent Lian Cheng and Guan Zhi Fu to garrison Kui Qiu; they went at melon time; and were replaced at melon time.

sentences.zh: 往戍一歲，卒瓜時而公弗為發代。

translations.literal: Went garrison one year, ended melon time and duke not for sent replacement.
translations.idiomatic: They went to garrison for one year; when melon time ended, the duke did not send replacements for them.

sentences.zh: 或為請代，公弗許。

translations.literal: Someone for requested replacement, duke not permitted.
translations.idiomatic: Someone requested replacements for them; the duke did not permit it.

sentences.zh: 故此二人怒，因公孫無知謀作亂。

translations.literal: Therefore these two angered, through Gong Sun Wu Zhi plotted to make rebellion.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore these two were angered; through Gong Sun Wu Zhi they plotted to make rebellion.

sentences.zh: 連稱有從妹在公宮，無寵，使之閒襄公，曰「事成以女為無知夫人」。

translations.literal: Lian Cheng had younger maternal sister in duke palace, no favor, made her spy Xiang Gong, said 'matter succeeds with woman as Wu Zhi wife'.
translations.idiomatic: Lian Cheng had a younger maternal sister in the duke's palace who had no favor; he made her spy on Xiang Gong, saying 'if the matter succeeds, I will make you Wu Zhi's wife.'

sentences.zh: 冬十二月，襄公游姑棼，遂獵沛丘。

translations.literal: Winter twelfth month, Xiang Gong toured Gu Fen, then hunted Pei Qiu.
translations.idiomatic: In the winter twelfth month, Xiang Gong toured Gu Fen; then hunted at Pei Qiu.

sentences.zh: 見彘，從者曰「彭生」。

translations.literal: Saw pig, followers said 'Peng Sheng'.
translations.idiomatic: He saw a pig; his followers said 'Peng Sheng.'

sentences.zh: 公怒，射之，彘人立而啼。

translations.literal: Duke angered, shot it, pig person stood and cried.
translations.idiomatic: The duke was angered; shot it; the pig person stood and cried.

sentences.zh: 公懼，墜車傷足，失屨。

translations.literal: Duke feared, fell from chariot injured foot, lost shoe.
translations.idiomatic: The duke was fearful; fell from the chariot and injured his foot; lost his shoe.

sentences.zh: 反而鞭主屨者茀三百。

translations.literal: Returned and whipped shoe master Fu three hundred.
translations.idiomatic: Upon returning, he whipped Fu, the master of shoes, three hundred lashes.

sentences.zh: 茀出宮。

translations.literal: Fu exited palace.
translations.idiomatic: Fu exited the palace.

sentences.zh: 而無知、連稱、管至父等聞公傷，乃遂率其眾襲宮。

translations.literal: And Wu Zhi, Lian Cheng, Guan Zhi Fu etc heard duke injured, then then led their masses surprise attacked palace.
translations.idiomatic: Wu Zhi, Lian Cheng, Guan Zhi Fu and others heard the duke was injured; they then led their masses to surprise attack the palace.

sentences.zh: 逢主屨茀，茀曰：「且無入驚宮，驚宮未易入也。」

translations.literal: Met shoe master Fu, Fu said: 'Moreover do not enter alarm palace, alarming palace not easy enter also.'
translations.idiomatic: They met Fu, the master of shoes; Fu said: 'Moreover do not enter and alarm the palace; alarming the palace is not easy to enter.'

sentences.zh: 無知弗信，茀示之創，乃信之。

translations.literal: Wu Zhi not believed, Fu showed him wound, then believed him.
translations.idiomatic: Wu Zhi did not believe; Fu showed him the wound; then he believed him.

sentences.zh: 待宮外，令茀先入。

translations.literal: Waited palace outside, ordered Fu first enter.
translations.idiomatic: They waited outside the palace; ordered Fu to enter first.

sentences.zh: 茀先入，即匿襄公戶閒。

translations.literal: Fu first entered, immediately hid Xiang Gong door between.
translations.idiomatic: Fu entered first; immediately hid Xiang Gong between the doors.

sentences.zh: 良久，無知等恐，遂入宮。

translations.literal: Very long time, Wu Zhi etc feared, then entered palace.
translations.idiomatic: After a very long time, Wu Zhi and others feared; then entered the palace.

sentences.zh: 茀反與宮中及公之幸臣攻無知等，不勝，皆死。

translations.literal: Fu instead with palace inside and duke favored ministers attacked Wu Zhi etc, not victorious, all died.
translations.idiomatic: Fu instead attacked Wu Zhi and others together with those inside the palace and the duke's favored ministers; they were not victorious; all died.

sentences.zh: 無知入宮，求公不得。

translations.literal: Wu Zhi entered palace, sought duke not obtained.
translations.idiomatic: Wu Zhi entered the palace; sought the duke but did not obtain him.

sentences.zh: 或見人足於戶閒，發視，乃襄公，遂弒之，而無知自立為齊君。

translations.literal: Someone saw person feet at door between, opened looked, was Xiang Gong, then assassinated him, and Wu Zhi self established as Qi lord.
translations.idiomatic: Someone saw a person's feet between the doors; opened and looked; it was Xiang Gong; then assassinated him; and Wu Zhi established himself as Qi lord.

sentences.zh: 桓公元年春，齊君無知游於雍林。

translations.literal: Huan Gong first year spring, Qi lord Wu Zhi toured at Yong Lin.
translations.idiomatic: In Huan Gong's first year spring, Qi lord Wu Zhi toured at Yong Lin.

sentences.zh: 雍林人嘗有怨無知，及其往游，雍林人襲殺無知，告齊大夫曰：「無知弒襄公自立，臣謹行誅。

translations.literal: Yong Lin person once had resentment Wu Zhi, and when he went touring, Yong Lin person surprise killed Wu Zhi, told Qi grand masters said: 'Wu Zhi assassinated Xiang Gong self established, minister respectfully executed punishment.'
translations.idiomatic: A Yong Lin person once had resentment toward Wu Zhi; when he went touring, the Yong Lin person surprise killed Wu Zhi; told the Qi grand masters saying: 'Wu Zhi assassinated Xiang Gong and established himself; this minister respectfully executed punishment.'

sentences.zh: 唯大夫更立公子之當立者，唯命是聽。」

translations.literal: Only grand masters moreover establish duke son who should be established, only command follow.'
translations.idiomatic: 'Only the grand masters moreover establish the duke's son who should be established; only follow the command.'

sentences.zh: 初，襄公之醉殺魯桓公，通其夫人，殺誅數不當，淫於婦人，數欺大臣，群弟恐禍及，故次弟糾奔魯。

translations.literal: Initially, Xiang Gong drunk killed Lu Huan Gong, communicated with his consort, killed punished number not proper, licentious with women, often deceived ministers, group younger brothers feared calamity reach, therefore second younger brother Jiu fled Lu.
translations.idiomatic: Initially, Xiang Gong, when drunk, killed Lu Huan Gong; communicated with his consort; the number of killings and punishments was not proper; was licentious with women; often deceived ministers; his group of younger brothers feared calamity would reach them; therefore the second younger brother Jiu fled to Lu.

sentences.zh: 其母魯女也。

translations.literal: His mother Lu woman also.
translations.idiomatic: His mother was a Lu woman.

sentences.zh: 管仲、召忽傅之。

translations.literal: Guan Zhong, Zhao Hu tutored him.
translations.idiomatic: Guan Zhong and Zhao Hu tutored him.

sentences.zh: 次弟小白奔莒，鮑叔傅之。

translations.literal: Second younger brother Xiao Bai fled Ju, Bao Shu tutored him.
translations.idiomatic: The second younger brother Xiao Bai fled to Ju; Bao Shu tutored him.

sentences.zh: 小白母，衛女也，有寵於釐公。

translations.literal: Xiao Bai mother, Wei woman also, had favor with Xi Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Xiao Bai's mother was a Wei woman; she had favor with Xi Gong.

sentences.zh: 小白自少好善大夫高傒。

translations.literal: Xiao Bai from young good befriended grand master Gao Xi.
translations.idiomatic: From youth, Xiao Bai befriended the worthy grand master Gao Xi.

sentences.zh: 及雍林人殺無知，議立君，高、國先陰召小白於莒。

translations.literal: And Yong Lin person killed Wu Zhi, discussed establish lord, Gao, Guo first secretly summoned Xiao Bai at Ju.
translations.idiomatic: When the Yong Lin person killed Wu Zhi, they discussed establishing a lord; Gao and Guo first secretly summoned Xiao Bai from Ju.

sentences.zh: 魯聞無知死，亦發兵送公子糾，而使管仲別將兵遮莒道，射中小白帶鉤。

translations.literal: Lu heard Wu Zhi dead, also sent troops escorted duke son Jiu, and made Guan Zhong separately led troops blocked Ju road, shot Xiao Bai belt hook.
translations.idiomatic: Lu heard Wu Zhi was dead; also sent troops to escort duke son Jiu; and made Guan Zhong separately lead troops to block the Ju road; shot Xiao Bai's belt hook.

sentences.zh: 小白詳死，管仲使人馳報魯。

translations.literal: Xiao Bai pretended dead, Guan Zhong sent person galloped reported Lu.
translations.idiomatic: Xiao Bai pretended to be dead; Guan Zhong sent a person to gallop and report to Lu.

sentences.zh: 魯送糾者行益遲，六日至齊，則小白已入，高傒立之，是為桓公。

translations.literal: Lu sent Jiu persons went moreover slow, six days arrived Qi, then Xiao Bai already entered, Gao Xi established him, this was Huan Gong.
translations.idiomatic: The Lu people sending Jiu went moreover slowly; six days to arrive at Qi; then Xiao Bai had already entered; Gao Xi established him; this was Huan Gong.

sentences.zh: 桓公之中鉤，詳死以誤管仲，已而載溫車中馳行，亦有高、國內應，故得先入立，發兵距魯。

translations.literal: Huan Gong hit hook, pretended dead to mislead Guan Zhong, then loaded warm chariot middle galloped went, also had Gao, Guo internal response, therefore got first enter establish, sent troops resisted Lu.
translations.idiomatic: Huan Gong was hit by the hook; pretended dead to mislead Guan Zhong; then loaded himself in a warm chariot and galloped away; also had Gao and Guo's internal response; therefore got to enter and establish himself first; sent troops to resist Lu.

sentences.zh: 秋，與魯戰于乾時，魯兵敗走，齊兵掩絕魯歸道。

translations.literal: Autumn, with Lu battled at Gan Shi, Lu troops defeated fled, Qi troops ambushed cut off Lu return road.
translations.idiomatic: In autumn, battled with Lu at Gan Shi; Lu troops were defeated and fled; Qi troops ambushed and cut off Lu's return road.

sentences.zh: 齊遺魯書曰：「子糾兄弟，弗忍誅，請魯自殺之。

translations.literal: Qi sent Lu letter said: 'Zi Jiu brothers, not bear execute, please Lu self kill him.'
translations.idiomatic: Qi sent a letter to Lu saying: 'Zi Jiu is our brother; we cannot bear to execute him; please Lu kill him yourself.'

sentences.zh: 召忽、管仲讎也，請得而甘心醢之。

translations.literal: Zhao Hu, Guan Zhong enemies also, please get and satisfy heart pickle them.'
translations.idiomatic: 'Zhao Hu and Guan Zhong are our enemies; please get them and satisfy our hearts by pickling them.'

sentences.zh: 不然，將圍魯。」

translations.literal: Not so, will surround Lu.'
translations.idiomatic: 'If not, we will surround Lu.'

sentences.zh: 魯人患之，遂殺子糾于笙瀆。

translations.literal: Lu people worried about it, then killed Zi Jiu at Sheng Du.
translations.idiomatic: The Lu people were worried about it; then killed Zi Jiu at Sheng Du.

sentences.zh: 召忽自殺，管仲請囚。

translations.literal: Zhao Hu committed suicide, Guan Zhong requested imprisonment.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Hu committed suicide; Guan Zhong requested imprisonment.

sentences.zh: 桓公之立，發兵攻魯，心欲殺管仲。

translations.literal: Huan Gong established, sent troops attacked Lu, heart wanted kill Guan Zhong.
translations.idiomatic: When Huan Gong was established, he sent troops to attack Lu; in his heart he wanted to kill Guan Zhong.

sentences.zh: 鮑叔牙曰：「臣幸得從君，君竟以立。

translations.literal: Bao Shu Ya said: 'Minister fortunate got follow lord, lord finally established.'
translations.idiomatic: Bao Shu Ya said: 'This minister was fortunate to follow the lord; the lord was finally established.'

sentences.zh: 君之尊，臣無以增君。

translations.literal: Lord honored, minister nothing with increase lord.'
translations.idiomatic: 'The lord's honor cannot be increased by this minister.'

sentences.zh: 君將治齊，即高傒與叔牙足也。

translations.literal: Lord about to govern Qi, then Gao Xi with Shu Ya sufficient also.'
translations.idiomatic: 'If the lord is about to govern Qi, then Gao Xi and Shu Ya are sufficient.'

sentences.zh: 君且欲霸王，非管夷吾不可。

translations.literal: Lord moreover wants hegemon king, not Guan Yi Wu not possible.'
translations.idiomatic: 'If the lord moreover wants to be hegemon king, only Guan Yi Wu is possible.'

sentences.zh: 夷吾所居國國重，不可失也。」

translations.literal: Yi Wu where resides states states heavy, cannot lose also.'
translations.idiomatic: 'Yi Wu's presence makes states heavy; he cannot be lost.'

sentences.zh: 於是桓公從之。

translations.literal: Therefore Huan Gong followed it.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore Huan Gong followed this.

sentences.zh: 乃詳為召管仲欲甘心，實欲用之。

translations.literal: Then pretended summoned Guan Zhong wanted satisfy heart, actually wanted use him.
translations.idiomatic: Then he pretended to summon Guan Zhong to satisfy his heart; actually he wanted to use him.

sentences.zh: 管仲知之，故請往。

translations.literal: Guan Zhong knew it, therefore requested go.
translations.idiomatic: Guan Zhong knew this; therefore he requested to go.

sentences.zh: 鮑叔牙迎受管仲，及堂阜而脫桎梏，齋祓而見桓公。

translations.literal: Bao Shu Ya welcomed received Guan Zhong, and Tang Fu then removed fetters, purified and saw Huan Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Bao Shu Ya welcomed and received Guan Zhong; at Tang Fu he removed the fetters; purified and saw Huan Gong.

sentences.zh: 桓公厚禮以為大夫，任政。

translations.literal: Huan Gong thickly gifted made grand master, entrusted government.
translations.idiomatic: Huan Gong thickly gifted him and made him grand master; entrusted him with government.

sentences.zh: 桓公既得管仲，與鮑叔、隰朋、高傒修齊國政，連五家之兵，設輕重魚鹽之利，以贍貧窮，祿賢能，齊人皆說。

translations.literal: Huan Gong already got Guan Zhong, with Bao Shu, Xi Peng, Gao Xi repaired Qi state government, connected five families troops, set light heavy fish salt profits, to relieve poor, salary worthy able, Qi people all pleased.
translations.idiomatic: Huan Gong already got Guan Zhong; with Bao Shu, Xi Peng, and Gao Xi repaired Qi state government; connected the five families' troops; set up light and heavy fish and salt profits; to relieve the poor; salaried the worthy and able; Qi people were all pleased.

sentences.zh: 二年，伐滅郯，郯子奔莒。

translations.literal: Second year, attacked extinguished Tan, Tan Zi fled Ju.
translations.idiomatic: In the second year, attacked and extinguished Tan; Tan Zi fled to Ju.

sentences.zh: 初，桓公亡時，過郯，郯無禮，故伐之。

translations.literal: Initially, Huan Gong fled time, passed Tan, Tan without courtesy, therefore attacked it.
translations.idiomatic: Initially, when Huan Gong fled, he passed Tan; Tan was without courtesy; therefore he attacked it.

sentences.zh: 五年，伐魯，魯將師敗。

translations.literal: Fifth year, attacked Lu, Lu general army defeated.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifth year, attacked Lu; Lu's general and army were defeated.

sentences.zh: 魯莊公請獻遂邑以平，桓公許，與魯會柯而盟。

translations.literal: Lu Zhuang Gong requested offered Sui city to pacify, Huan Gong permitted, with Lu met at Ke and allied.
translations.idiomatic: Lu Zhuang Gong requested to offer Sui city to pacify; Huan Gong permitted; met with Lu at Ke and allied.

sentences.zh: 魯將盟，曹沬以匕首劫桓公於壇上，曰：「反魯之侵地！」

translations.literal: Lu about to ally, Cao Mo with dagger hijacked Huan Gong on altar, said: 'Return Lu invaded land!'
translations.idiomatic: Lu was about to ally; Cao Mo with dagger hijacked Huan Gong on the altar, said: 'Return Lu's invaded land!'

sentences.zh: 桓公許之。

translations.literal: Huan Gong permitted it.
translations.idiomatic: Huan Gong permitted it.

sentences.zh: 已而曹沬去匕首，北面就臣位。

translations.literal: Then Cao Mo put away dagger, north faced took minister position.
translations.idiomatic: Then Cao Mo put away the dagger; faced north and took a minister position.

sentences.zh: 桓公後悔，欲無與魯地而殺曹沬。

translations.literal: Huan Gong regretted, wanted not give Lu land and kill Cao Mo.
translations.idiomatic: Huan Gong regretted; wanted not to give Lu the land and kill Cao Mo.

sentences.zh: 管仲曰：「夫劫許之而倍信殺之，愈一小快耳，而棄信於諸侯，失天下之援，不可。」

translations.literal: Guan Zhong said: 'Hijack permitted it and double faith kill him, only one small pleasure, and abandon faith among feudal lords, lose world support, cannot.'
translations.idiomatic: Guan Zhong said: 'To hijack and permit it, then double-cross and kill him, is only one small pleasure; and abandon faith among the feudal lords; lose the world's support; cannot.'

sentences.zh: 於是遂與曹沬三敗所亡地於魯。

translations.literal: Therefore then gave Cao Mo three times the lost land to Lu.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore he then gave Cao Mo three times the lost land to Lu.

sentences.zh: 諸侯聞之，皆信齊而欲附焉。

translations.literal: Feudal lords heard it, all trusted Qi and wanted attach to it.
translations.idiomatic: The feudal lords heard this; all trusted Qi and wanted to attach to it.

sentences.zh: 七年，諸侯會桓公於甄，而桓公於是始霸焉。

translations.literal: Seventh year, feudal lords met Huan Gong at Zhen, and Huan Gong therefore began hegemony.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventh year, the feudal lords met Huan Gong at Zhen; and Huan Gong therefore began his hegemony.

sentences.zh: 十四年，陳厲公子完，號敬仲，來奔齊。

translations.literal: Fourteenth year, Chen Li Gong son Wan, styled Jing Zhong, came fled to Qi.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourteenth year, Chen Li Gong's son Wan, styled Jing Zhong, came fleeing to Qi.

sentences.zh: 齊桓公欲以為卿，讓；

translations.literal: Qi Huan Gong wanted make him minister, declined;
translations.idiomatic: Qi Huan Gong wanted to make him a minister; he declined;

sentences.zh: 於是以為工正。

translations.literal: therefore made him artisan chief.
translations.idiomatic: therefore made him the artisan chief.

sentences.zh: 田成子常之祖也。

translations.literal: Tian Cheng Zi Chang ancestor also.
translations.idiomatic: He was Tian Cheng Zi Chang's ancestor.

sentences.zh: 二十三年，山戎伐燕，燕告急於齊。

translations.literal: Twenty-third year, Shan Rong attacked Yan, Yan urgently reported to Qi.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-third year, Shan Rong attacked Yan; Yan urgently reported to Qi.

sentences.zh: 齊桓公救燕，遂伐山戎，至于孤竹而還。

translations.literal: Qi Huan Gong saved Yan, then attacked Shan Rong, arrived at Gu Zhu and returned.
translations.idiomatic: Qi Huan Gong saved Yan; then attacked Shan Rong; arrived at Gu Zhu and returned.

sentences.zh: 燕莊公遂送桓公入齊境。

translations.literal: Yan Zhuang Gong then sent Huan Gong enter Qi territory.
translations.idiomatic: Yan Zhuang Gong then escorted Huan Gong into Qi territory.

sentences.zh: 桓公曰：「非天子，諸侯相送不出境，吾不可以無禮於燕。」

translations.literal: Huan Gong said: 'Not Son of Heaven, feudal lords mutually send not exit territory, I cannot without courtesy to Yan.'
translations.idiomatic: Huan Gong said: 'Except for the Son of Heaven, feudal lords who mutually escort do not exit territory; I cannot be discourteous to Yan.'

sentences.zh: 於是分溝割燕君所至與燕，命燕君復修召公之政，納貢于周，如成康之時。

translations.literal: Therefore divided ditch cut Yan lord arrived place gave Yan, commanded Yan lord again repaired Zhao Gong government, submitted tribute to Zhou, like Cheng Kang time.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore he divided the ditch and cut off the place where the Yan lord had arrived and gave it to Yan; commanded the Yan lord to again repair Zhao Gong's government; submit tribute to Zhou; like the Cheng Kang time.

sentences.zh: 諸侯聞之，皆從齊。

translations.literal: Feudal lords heard it, all followed Qi.
translations.idiomatic: The feudal lords heard this; all followed Qi.

sentences.zh: 二十七年，魯湣公母曰哀姜，桓公女弟也。

translations.literal: Twenty-seventh year, Lu Min Gong mother called Ai Jiang, Huan Gong younger sister also.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-seventh year, Lu Min Gong's mother was called Ai Jiang; she was Huan Gong's younger sister.

sentences.zh: 哀姜淫於魯公子慶父，慶父弒湣公，哀姜欲立慶父，魯人更立釐公。

translations.literal: Ai Jiang licentious with Lu duke son Qing Fu, Qing Fu assassinated Min Gong, Ai Jiang wanted establish Qing Fu, Lu people moreover established Xi Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Ai Jiang was licentious with Lu duke son Qing Fu; Qing Fu assassinated Min Gong; Ai Jiang wanted to establish Qing Fu; Lu people moreover established Xi Gong.

sentences.zh: 桓公召哀姜，殺之。

translations.literal: Huan Gong summoned Ai Jiang, killed her.
translations.idiomatic: Huan Gong summoned Ai Jiang; killed her.

sentences.zh: 二十八年，衛文公有狄亂，告急於齊。

translations.literal: Twenty-eighth year, Wei Wen Gong had Di chaos, urgently reported to Qi.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-eighth year, Wei Wen Gong had Di chaos; urgently reported to Qi.

sentences.zh: 齊率諸侯城楚丘而立衛君。

translations.literal: Qi led feudal lords walled Chu Qiu and established Wei lord.
translations.idiomatic: Qi led the feudal lords to wall Chu Qiu and establish the Wei lord.

sentences.zh: 二十九年，桓公與夫人蔡姬戲船中。

translations.literal: Twenty-ninth year, Huan Gong with consort Cai Ji played in boat.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-ninth year, Huan Gong with consort Cai Ji played in a boat.

sentences.zh: 蔡姬習水，蕩公，公懼，止之，不止，出船，怒，歸蔡姬，弗絕。

translations.literal: Cai Ji accustomed to water, rocked duke, duke feared, stopped her, not stop, exited boat, angered, returned Cai Ji, not divorced.
translations.idiomatic: Cai Ji was accustomed to water; rocked the duke; the duke feared; stopped her; she did not stop; exited the boat; angered; returned Cai Ji; did not divorce her.

sentences.zh: 蔡亦怒，嫁其女。

translations.literal: Cai also angered, married off his daughter.
translations.idiomatic: Cai also angered; married off his daughter.

sentences.zh: 桓公聞而怒，興師往伐。

translations.literal: Huan Gong heard and angered, raised troops went attacked.
translations.idiomatic: Huan Gong heard and angered; raised troops and went to attack.

sentences.zh: 三十年春，齊桓公率諸侯伐蔡，蔡潰。

translations.literal: Thirtieth year spring, Qi Huan Gong led feudal lords attacked Cai, Cai collapsed.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirtieth year spring, Qi Huan Gong led the feudal lords to attack Cai; Cai collapsed.

sentences.zh: 遂伐楚。

translations.literal: Then attacked Chu.
translations.idiomatic: Then attacked Chu.

sentences.zh: 楚成王興師問曰：「何故涉吾地？」

translations.literal: Chu Cheng Wang raised troops asked: 'Why wade my land?'
translations.idiomatic: Chu Cheng Wang raised troops and asked: 'Why do you wade through my land?'

sentences.zh: 管仲對曰：「昔召康公命我先君太公曰：『五侯九伯，若實征之，以夾輔周室。』

translations.literal: Guan Zhong replied said: 'Formerly Zhao Kang Gong commanded my late lord Tai Gong said: "five marquises nine earls, if truly campaign them, to flank assist Zhou house."'
translations.idiomatic: Guan Zhong replied: 'Formerly Zhao Kang Gong commanded my late lord Tai Gong saying: "Five marquises and nine earls, if you truly campaign against them, to flank and assist the Zhou house."'

sentences.zh: 賜我先君履，東至海，西至河，南至穆陵，北至無棣。

translations.literal: Granted my late lord shoe, east to sea, west to river, south to Mu Ling, north to Wu Di.'
translations.idiomatic: 'Granted my late lord shoes; east to the sea, west to the river, south to Mu Ling, north to Wu Di.'

sentences.zh: 楚貢包茅不入，王祭不具，是以來責。

translations.literal: Chu tribute wrapped thatch not enter, Wang sacrifice not complete, therefore come blame.'
translations.idiomatic: 'Chu tribute of wrapped thatch does not enter; the Wang's sacrifices are not complete; therefore I come to blame.'

sentences.zh: 昭王南征不復，是以來問。」

translations.literal: Zhao Wang south campaign not return, therefore come ask.'
translations.idiomatic: 'Zhao Wang's southern campaign did not return; therefore I come to ask.'

sentences.zh: 楚王曰：「貢之不入，有之，寡人罪也，敢不共乎！

translations.literal: Chu Wang said: 'Tribute not enter, have it, I crime also, dare not provide!'
translations.idiomatic: Chu Wang said: 'The tribute not entering, I have it; it is my crime; dare I not provide it!'

sentences.zh: 昭王之出不復，君其問之水濱。」

translations.literal: Zhao Wang out not return, lord should ask water shore.'
translations.idiomatic: 'Zhao Wang went out and did not return; my lord should ask the water's edge.'

sentences.zh: 齊師進次于陘。

translations.literal: Qi troops advanced camped at Xing.
translations.idiomatic: Qi troops advanced and camped at Xing.

sentences.zh: 夏，楚王使屈完將兵捍齊，齊師退次召陵。

translations.literal: Summer, Chu Wang sent Qu Wan led troops defended Qi, Qi troops retreated camped Zhao Ling.
translations.idiomatic: In summer, Chu Wang sent Qu Wan to lead troops to defend against Qi; Qi troops retreated and camped at Zhao Ling.

sentences.zh: 桓公矜屈完以其眾。

translations.literal: Huan Gong pitied Qu Wan with his masses.
translations.idiomatic: Huan Gong pitied Qu Wan with his masses.

sentences.zh: 屈完曰：「君以道則可；

translations.literal: Qu Wan said: 'Lord with Way then possible;'
translations.idiomatic: Qu Wan said: 'If my lord uses the Way, then it is possible;'

sentences.zh: 若不，則楚方城以為城，江、漢以為溝，君安能進乎？」

translations.literal: If not, then Chu Fang Cheng as city, Jiang, Han as moat, lord how can advance?'
translations.idiomatic: 'If not, then Chu takes Fang Cheng as its city, the Jiang and Han as its moat; how can my lord advance?'

sentences.zh: 乃與屈完盟而去。

translations.literal: Then with Qu Wan allied and left.
translations.idiomatic: Then allied with Qu Wan and left.

sentences.zh: 過陳，陳袁濤涂詐齊，令出東方，覺。

translations.literal: Passed Chen, Chen Yuan Tao Tu deceived Qi, ordered exit east, discovered.
translations.idiomatic: Passed Chen; Chen Yuan Tao Tu deceived Qi; ordered them to exit to the east; discovered.

sentences.zh: 秋，齊伐陳。

translations.literal: Autumn, Qi attacked Chen.
translations.idiomatic: In autumn, Qi attacked Chen.

sentences.zh: 是歲，晉殺太子申生。

translations.literal: This year, Jin killed crown prince Shen Sheng.
translations.idiomatic: In this year, Jin killed crown prince Shen Sheng.

sentences.zh: 三十五年夏，會諸侯于葵丘。

translations.literal: Thirty-fifth year summer, met feudal lords at Kui Qiu.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-fifth year summer, met the feudal lords at Kui Qiu.

sentences.zh: 周襄王使宰孔賜桓公文武胙、彤弓矢、大路，命無拜。

translations.literal: Zhou Xiang Wang sent prime minister Kong granted Huan Gong Wen Wu thigh meat, red bow arrows, grand chariot, commanded no bow.
translations.idiomatic: Zhou Xiang Wang sent prime minister Kong to grant Huan Gong Wen Wu thigh meat, red bow and arrows, grand chariot; commanded him not to bow.

sentences.zh: 桓公欲許之，管仲曰「不可」，乃下拜受賜。

translations.literal: Huan Gong wanted permit it, Guan Zhong said 'cannot', then descended bowed received grant.
translations.idiomatic: Huan Gong wanted to permit it; Guan Zhong said 'cannot'; then descended, bowed, and received the grant.

sentences.zh: 秋，復會諸侯於葵丘，益有驕色。

translations.literal: Autumn, again met feudal lords at Kui Qiu, moreover had arrogant appearance.
translations.idiomatic: In autumn, again met the feudal lords at Kui Qiu; moreover had an arrogant appearance.

sentences.zh: 周使宰孔會。

translations.literal: Zhou sent prime minister Kong met.
translations.idiomatic: Zhou sent prime minister Kong to the meeting.

sentences.zh: 諸侯頗有叛者。

translations.literal: Feudal lords rather had rebels.
translations.idiomatic: The feudal lords rather had some rebels.

sentences.zh: 晉侯病，後，遇宰孔。

translations.literal: Jin Hou ill, later, met prime minister Kong.
translations.idiomatic: Jin Hou was ill; later, met prime minister Kong.

sentences.zh: 宰孔曰：「齊侯驕矣，弟無行。」

translations.literal: Prime minister Kong said: 'Qi Hou arrogant already, younger brother do not go.'
translations.idiomatic: Prime minister Kong said: 'Qi Hou is arrogant already; younger brother, do not go.'

sentences.zh: 從之。

translations.literal: Followed it.
translations.idiomatic: He followed this.

sentences.zh: 是歲，晉獻公卒，裏克殺奚齊、卓子，秦穆公以夫人入公子夷吾為晉君。

translations.literal: This year, Jin Xian Gong died, Li Ke killed Xi Qi, Zhuo Zi, Qin Mu Gong with consort brought duke son Yi Wu entered as Jin lord.
translations.idiomatic: In this year, Jin Xian Gong died; Li Ke killed Xi Qi and Zhuo Zi; Qin Mu Gong with his consort brought duke son Yi Wu to enter as Jin lord.

sentences.zh: 桓公於是討晉亂，至高梁，使隰朋立晉君，還。

translations.literal: Huan Gong therefore punished Jin chaos, arrived Gao Liang, made Xi Peng establish Jin lord, returned.
translations.idiomatic: Huan Gong therefore punished Jin's chaos; arrived at Gao Liang; made Xi Peng establish the Jin lord; returned.

sentences.zh: 是時周室微，唯齊、楚、秦、晉為彊。

translations.literal: This time Zhou house weak, only Qi, Chu, Qin, Jin were strong.
translations.idiomatic: At this time the Zhou house was weak; only Qi, Chu, Qin, and Jin were strong.

sentences.zh: 晉初與會，獻公死，國內亂。

translations.literal: Jin initially with met, Xian Gong died, state inside chaotic.
translations.idiomatic: Jin initially participated in the meeting; Xian Gong died; the state inside was chaotic.

sentences.zh: 秦穆公辟遠，不與中國會盟。

translations.literal: Qin Mu Gong avoided distant, not with central states met allied.
translations.idiomatic: Qin Mu Gong avoided being distant; did not meet and ally with the central states.

sentences.zh: 楚成王初收荊蠻有之，夷狄自置。

translations.literal: Chu Cheng Wang initially gathered Jing Man had them, Yi Di self established.
translations.idiomatic: Chu Cheng Wang initially gathered the Jing Man barbarians and had them; the Yi Di established themselves.

sentences.zh: 唯獨齊為中國會盟，而桓公能宣其德，故諸侯賓會。

translations.literal: Only alone Qi for central states met allied, and Huan Gong able proclaimed his virtue, therefore feudal lords guest met.
translations.idiomatic: Only Qi alone conducted meetings and alliances for the central states; and Huan Gong was able to proclaim his virtue; therefore the feudal lords guest-attended the meetings.

sentences.zh: 於是桓公稱曰：「寡人南伐至召陵，望熊山；

translations.literal: Therefore Huan Gong called said: 'I south attacked arrived Zhao Ling, gazed Xiong Shan;'
translations.idiomatic: Therefore Huan Gong declared: 'I south attacked and arrived at Zhao Ling; gazed at Xiong Shan;'

sentences.zh: 北伐山戎、離枝、孤竹；

translations.literal: north attacked Shan Rong, Li Zhi, Gu Zhu;'
translations.idiomatic: north attacked Shan Rong, Li Zhi, Gu Zhu;'

sentences.zh: 西伐大夏，涉流沙；

translations.literal: west attacked Da Xia, waded flowing sand;'
translations.idiomatic: west attacked Da Xia; waded the flowing sands;'

sentences.zh: 束馬懸車登太行，至卑耳山而還。

translations.literal: bound horses hung chariots ascended Tai Hang, arrived Bei Er Shan and returned.'
translations.idiomatic: bound the horses and hung the chariots to ascend Tai Hang; arrived at Bei Er Shan and returned.'

sentences.zh: 諸侯莫違寡人。

translations.literal: feudal lords none violated I.'
translations.idiomatic: The feudal lords none violated me.'

sentences.zh: 寡人兵車之會三，乘車之會六，九合諸侯，一匡天下。

translations.literal: I war chariot meetings three, riding chariot meetings six, nine united feudal lords, once corrected world.'
translations.idiomatic: I have had three meetings of war chariots; six meetings of riding chariots; nine times united the feudal lords; once corrected the world.'

sentences.zh: 昔三代受命，有何以異於此乎？

translations.literal: Former three dynasties received mandate, had what different from this?'
translations.idiomatic: The former three dynasties received the mandate; what was different from this?'

sentences.zh: 吾欲封泰山，禪梁父。」

translations.literal: I want seal Tai Shan, zen Liang Fu.'
translations.idiomatic: I want to seal Tai Shan; zen Liang Fu.'

sentences.zh: 管仲固諫，不聽；

translations.literal: Guan Zhong firmly advised, not listened;
translations.idiomatic: Guan Zhong firmly advised; he did not listen;

sentences.zh: 乃說桓公以遠方珍怪物至乃得封，桓公乃止。

translations.literal: then persuaded Huan Gong with distant regions rare strange things arrived then got seal, Huan Gong then stopped.
translations.idiomatic: then persuaded Huan Gong that when rare and strange things from distant regions arrived, then he could get the seal; Huan Gong then stopped.

sentences.zh: 三十八年，周襄王弟帶與戎、翟合謀伐周，齊使管仲平戎於周。

translations.literal: Thirty-eighth year, Zhou Xiang Wang younger brother Dai with Rong, Di jointly plotted attacked Zhou, Qi sent Guan Zhong pacified Rong at Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-eighth year, Zhou Xiang Wang's younger brother Dai with Rong and Di jointly plotted to attack Zhou; Qi sent Guan Zhong to pacify the Rong at Zhou.

sentences.zh: 周欲以上卿禮管仲，管仲頓首曰：「臣陪臣，安敢！」

translations.literal: Zhou wanted with upper minister rites Guan Zhong, Guan Zhong knocked head said: 'Minister attendant minister, how dare!'
translations.idiomatic: Zhou wanted to treat Guan Zhong with upper minister rites; Guan Zhong knocked his head and said: 'Minister is an attendant minister; how dare I!'

sentences.zh: 三讓，乃受下卿禮以見。

translations.literal: Three declined, then received lower minister rites to see.
translations.idiomatic: He declined three times; then received lower minister rites to see.

sentences.zh: 三十九年，周襄王弟帶來奔齊。

translations.literal: Thirty-ninth year, Zhou Xiang Wang younger brother Dai came fled to Qi.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-ninth year, Zhou Xiang Wang's younger brother Dai came fleeing to Qi.

sentences.zh: 齊使仲孫請王，為帶謝。

translations.literal: Qi sent Zhong Sun requested Wang, for Dai apologized.
translations.idiomatic: Qi sent Zhong Sun to request the Wang; apologized for Dai.

sentences.zh: 襄王怒，弗聽。

translations.literal: Xiang Wang angered, not listened.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Wang was angered; did not listen.

sentences.zh: 四十一年，秦穆公虜晉惠公，復歸之。

translations.literal: Forty-first year, Qin Mu Gong captured Jin Hui Gong, then returned him.
translations.idiomatic: In the forty-first year, Qin Mu Gong captured Jin Hui Gong; then returned him.

sentences.zh: 是歲，管仲、隰朋皆卒。

translations.literal: This year, Guan Zhong, Xi Peng both died.
translations.idiomatic: In this year, Guan Zhong and Xi Peng both died.

sentences.zh: 管仲病，桓公問曰：「群臣誰可相者？」

translations.literal: Guan Zhong ill, Huan Gong asked said: 'Ministers who can assist?'
translations.idiomatic: Guan Zhong was ill; Huan Gong asked: 'Which of the ministers can assist?'

sentences.zh: 管仲曰：「知臣莫如君。」

translations.literal: Guan Zhong said: 'Know minister none like lord.'
translations.idiomatic: Guan Zhong said: 'None knows ministers like the lord.'

sentences.zh: 公曰：「易牙如何？」

translations.literal: Duke said: 'Yi Ya how?'
translations.idiomatic: The duke said: 'What about Yi Ya?'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「殺子以適君，非人情，不可。」

translations.literal: Replied said: 'Kill son to please lord, not human feeling, cannot.'
translations.idiomatic: He replied: 'He killed his son to please the lord; not human feeling; cannot.'

sentences.zh: 公曰：「開方如何？」

translations.literal: Duke said: 'Kai Fang how?'
translations.idiomatic: The duke said: 'What about Kai Fang?'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「倍親以適君，非人情，難近。」

translations.literal: Replied said: 'Double parents to please lord, not human feeling, difficult near.'
translations.idiomatic: He replied: 'He abandoned his parents to please the lord; not human feeling; difficult to approach.'

sentences.zh: 公曰：「豎刀如何？」

translations.literal: Duke said: 'Shu Dao how?'
translations.idiomatic: The duke said: 'What about Shu Dao?'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「自宮以適君，非人情，難親。」

translations.literal: Replied said: 'Self castrate to please lord, not human feeling, difficult close.'
translations.idiomatic: He replied: 'He castrated himself to please the lord; not human feeling; difficult to be close to.'

sentences.zh: 管仲死，而桓公不用管仲言，卒近用三子，三子專權。

translations.literal: Guan Zhong died, and Huan Gong not used Guan Zhong words, finally approached used three sons, three sons monopolized power.
translations.idiomatic: Guan Zhong died; and Huan Gong did not use Guan Zhong's words; finally approached and used the three men; the three men monopolized power.

sentences.zh: 四十二年，戎伐周，周告急於齊，齊令諸侯各發卒戍周。

translations.literal: Forty-second year, Rong attacked Zhou, Zhou urgently reported to Qi, Qi commanded feudal lords each sent troops garrisoned Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: In the forty-second year, Rong attacked Zhou; Zhou urgently reported to Qi; Qi commanded the feudal lords to each send troops to garrison Zhou.

sentences.zh: 是歲，晉公子重耳來，桓公妻之。

translations.literal: This year, Jin duke son Chong Er came, Huan Gong married him.
translations.idiomatic: In this year, Jin duke son Chong Er came; Huan Gong married him to a daughter.

sentences.zh: 四十三年。

translations.literal: Forty-third year.
translations.idiomatic: Forty-third year.

sentences.zh: 初，齊桓公之夫人三：曰王姬、徐姬、蔡姬，皆無子。

translations.literal: Initially, Qi Huan Gong ladies three: called Wang Ji, Xu Ji, Cai Ji, all no sons.
translations.idiomatic: Initially, Qi Huan Gong had three ladies: called Wang Ji, Xu Ji, Cai Ji; all had no sons.

sentences.zh: 桓公好內，多內寵，如夫人者六人，長衛姬，生無詭；

translations.literal: Huan Gong liked inner, many inner favorites, like lady persons six, eldest Wei Ji, gave birth Wu Gui;
translations.idiomatic: Huan Gong liked the inner chambers; had many inner favorites; like lady persons six; eldest Wei Ji gave birth to Wu Gui;

sentences.zh: 少衛姬，生惠公元；

translations.literal: younger Wei Ji, gave birth Hui Gong Yuan;
translations.idiomatic: younger Wei Ji gave birth to Hui Gong Yuan;

sentences.zh: 鄭姬，生孝公昭；

translations.literal: Zheng Ji, gave birth Xiao Gong Zhao;
translations.idiomatic: Zheng Ji gave birth to Xiao Gong Zhao;

sentences.zh: 葛嬴，生昭公潘；

translations.literal: Ge Ying, gave birth Zhao Gong Pan;
translations.idiomatic: Ge Ying gave birth to Zhao Gong Pan;

sentences.zh: 密姬，生懿公商人；

translations.literal: Mi Ji, gave birth Yi Gong Shang Ren;
translations.idiomatic: Mi Ji gave birth to Yi Gong Shang Ren;

sentences.zh: 宋華子，生公子雍。

translations.literal: Song Hua Zi, gave birth duke son Yong.
translations.idiomatic: Song Hua Zi gave birth to duke son Yong.

sentences.zh: 桓公與管仲屬孝公於宋襄公，以為太子。

translations.literal: Huan Gong with Guan Zhong entrusted Xiao Gong to Song Xiang Gong, made crown prince.
translations.idiomatic: Huan Gong with Guan Zhong entrusted Xiao Gong to Song Xiang Gong; made him crown prince.

sentences.zh: 雍巫有寵於衛共姬，因宦者豎刀以厚獻於桓公，亦有寵，桓公許之立無詭。

translations.literal: Yong Wu had favor with Wei Gong Ji, through eunuch Shu Dao with thick gifts to Huan Gong, also had favor, Huan Gong permitted established Wu Gui.
translations.idiomatic: Yong Wu had favor with Wei Gong Ji; through the eunuch Shu Dao with thick gifts to Huan Gong; also had favor; Huan Gong permitted establishing Wu Gui.

sentences.zh: 管仲卒，五公子皆求立。

translations.literal: Guan Zhong died, five duke sons all sought establish.
translations.idiomatic: Guan Zhong died; the five duke sons all sought to be established.

sentences.zh: 冬十月乙亥，齊桓公卒。

translations.literal: Winter tenth month Yi Hai, Qi Huan Gong died.
translations.idiomatic: In winter tenth month on Yi Hai, Qi Huan Gong died.

sentences.zh: 易牙入，與豎刀因內寵殺群吏，而立公子無詭為君。

translations.literal: Yi Ya entered, with Shu Dao through inner favorites killed group officials, and established duke son Wu Gui as lord.
translations.idiomatic: Yi Ya entered; with Shu Dao through the inner favorites killed the group of officials; and established duke son Wu Gui as lord.

sentences.zh: 太子昭奔宋。

translations.literal: Crown prince Zhao fled Song.
translations.idiomatic: Crown prince Zhao fled to Song.

sentences.zh: 桓公病，五公子各樹黨爭立。

translations.literal: Huan Gong ill, five duke sons each planted factions contended establish.
translations.idiomatic: Huan Gong was ill; the five duke sons each planted factions and contended to be established.

sentences.zh: 及桓公卒，遂相攻，以故宮中空，莫敢棺。

translations.literal: And Huan Gong died, then mutually attacked, because palace middle empty, none dared coffin.
translations.idiomatic: When Huan Gong died, they then mutually attacked; because the palace middle was empty; none dared to coffin him.

sentences.zh: 桓公尸在床上六十七日，尸蟲出于戶。

translations.literal: Huan Gong corpse on bed sixty-seven days, corpse worms came out door.
translations.idiomatic: Huan Gong's corpse was on the bed for sixty-seven days; corpse worms came out the door.

sentences.zh: 十二月乙亥，無詭立，乃棺赴。

translations.literal: Twelfth month Yi Hai, Wu Gui established, then coffined went.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth month on Yi Hai, Wu Gui was established; then coffined and went.

sentences.zh: 辛巳夜，斂殯。

translations.literal: Xin Si night, collected encoffined.
translations.idiomatic: On Xin Si night, collected and encoffined.

sentences.zh: 桓公十有餘子，要其後立者五人：無詭立三月死，無謚；

translations.literal: Huan Gong ten plus sons, essential his later established persons five: Wu Gui established three months died, no posthumous name;
translations.idiomatic: Huan Gong had ten plus sons; essentially those who later were established numbered five: Wu Gui was established for three months and died, no posthumous name;

sentences.zh: 次孝公；

translations.literal: next Xiao Gong;
translations.idiomatic: next Xiao Gong;

sentences.zh: 次昭公；

translations.literal: next Zhao Gong;
translations.idiomatic: next Zhao Gong;

sentences.zh: 次懿公；

translations.literal: next Yi Gong;
translations.idiomatic: next Yi Gong;

sentences.zh: 次惠公。

translations.literal: next Hui Gong.
translations.idiomatic: next Hui Gong.

sentences.zh: 孝公元年三月，宋襄公率諸侯兵送齊太子昭而伐齊。

translations.literal: Xiao Gong first year third month, Song Xiang Gong led feudal lords troops sent Qi crown prince Zhao and attacked Qi.
translations.idiomatic: In Xiao Gong's first year third month, Song Xiang Gong led feudal lords' troops to send Qi crown prince Zhao and attacked Qi.

sentences.zh: 齊人恐，殺其君無詭。

translations.literal: Qi people feared, killed their lord Wu Gui.
translations.idiomatic: The Qi people feared; killed their lord Wu Gui.

sentences.zh: 齊人將立太子昭，四公子之徒攻太子，太子走宋，宋遂與齊人四公子戰。

translations.literal: Qi people about to establish crown prince Zhao, four duke sons followers attacked crown prince, crown prince fled Song, Song then with Qi people four duke sons battled.
translations.idiomatic: The Qi people were about to establish crown prince Zhao; the four duke sons' followers attacked the crown prince; the crown prince fled to Song; Song then battled with the Qi people's four duke sons.

sentences.zh: 五月，宋敗齊四公子師而立太子昭，是為齊孝公。

translations.literal: Fifth month, Song defeated Qi four duke sons army and established crown prince Zhao, this was Qi Xiao Gong.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifth month, Song defeated the Qi four duke sons' army and established crown prince Zhao; this was Qi Xiao Gong.

sentences.zh: 宋以桓公與管仲屬之太子，故來征之。

translations.literal: Song because Huan Gong with Guan Zhong entrusted crown prince, therefore came punished them.
translations.idiomatic: Song because Huan Gong with Guan Zhong entrusted the crown prince; therefore came to punish them.

sentences.zh: 以亂故，八月乃葬齊桓公。

translations.literal: Because chaos reason, eighth month then buried Qi Huan Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Because of the chaos, in the eighth month they then buried Qi Huan Gong.

sentences.zh: 六年春，齊伐宋，以其不同盟于齊也。

translations.literal: Sixth year spring, Qi attacked Song, because they not same allied at Qi also.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixth year spring, Qi attacked Song; because they did not same-ally at Qi.

sentences.zh: 夏，宋襄公卒。

translations.literal: Summer, Song Xiang Gong died.
translations.idiomatic: In summer, Song Xiang Gong died.

sentences.zh: 七年，晉文公立。

translations.literal: Seventh year, Jin Wen Gong established.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventh year, Jin Wen Gong was established.

sentences.zh: 十年，孝公卒，孝公弟潘因衛公子開方殺孝公子而立潘，是為昭公。

translations.literal: Tenth year, Xiao Gong died, Xiao Gong younger brother Pan through Wei duke son Kai Fang killed Xiao Gong son and established Pan, this was Zhao Gong.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth year, Xiao Gong died; Xiao Gong's younger brother Pan through Wei duke son Kai Fang killed Xiao Gong's son and established Pan; this was Zhao Gong.

sentences.zh: 昭公，桓公子也，其母曰葛嬴。

translations.literal: Zhao Gong, Huan Gong son also, his mother called Ge Ying.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Gong was Huan Gong's son; his mother was called Ge Ying.

sentences.zh: 昭公元年，晉文公敗楚於城濮，而會諸侯踐土，朝周，天子使晉稱伯。

translations.literal: Zhao Gong first year, Jin Wen Gong defeated Chu at Cheng Pu, and met feudal lords at Jian Tu, court Zhou, Son of Heaven made Jin called Bo.
translations.idiomatic: In Zhao Gong's first year, Jin Wen Gong defeated Chu at Cheng Pu; and met the feudal lords at Jian Tu; courted Zhou; the Son of Heaven made Jin called Bo.

sentences.zh: 六年，翟侵齊。

translations.literal: Sixth year, Di invaded Qi.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixth year, Di invaded Qi.

sentences.zh: 晉文公卒。

translations.literal: Jin Wen Gong died.
translations.idiomatic: Jin Wen Gong died.

sentences.zh: 秦兵敗於殽。

translations.literal: Qin troops defeated at Xiao.
translations.idiomatic: Qin troops were defeated at Xiao.

sentences.zh: 十二年，秦穆公卒。

translations.literal: Twelfth year, Qin Mu Gong died.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth year, Qin Mu Gong died.

sentences.zh: 十九年五月，昭公卒，子舍立為齊君。

translations.literal: Nineteenth year fifth month, Zhao Gong died, son She established as Qi lord.
translations.idiomatic: In the nineteenth year fifth month, Zhao Gong died; son She was established as Qi lord.

sentences.zh: 捨之母無寵於昭公，國人莫畏。

translations.literal: She's mother no favor with Zhao Gong, state people none feared.
translations.idiomatic: She's mother had no favor with Zhao Gong; the state people none feared.

sentences.zh: 昭公之弟商人以桓公死爭立而不得，陰交賢士，附愛百姓，百姓說。

translations.literal: Zhao Gong younger brother Shang Ren because Huan Gong death contended establish but not obtained, secretly befriended worthy scholars, attached loved common people, common people pleased.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Gong's younger brother Shang Ren because of Huan Gong's death contended to be established but did not obtain it; secretly befriended worthy scholars; attached and loved the common people; the common people were pleased.

sentences.zh: 及昭公卒，子舍立，孤弱，即與眾十月即墓上弒齊君舍，而商人自立，是為懿公。

translations.literal: And Zhao Gong died, son She established, orphan weak, immediately with masses tenth month at tomb above assassinated Qi lord She, and Shang Ren self established, this was Yi Gong.
translations.idiomatic: When Zhao Gong died, son She was established; orphan and weak; immediately with the masses in the tenth month at the tomb above assassinated Qi lord She; and Shang Ren self-established; this was Yi Gong.

sentences.zh: 懿公，桓公子也，其母曰密姬。

translations.literal: Yi Gong, Huan Gong son also, his mother called Mi Ji.
translations.idiomatic: Yi Gong was Huan Gong's son; his mother was called Mi Ji.

sentences.zh: 懿公四年春，初，懿公為公子時，與丙戎之父獵，爭獲不勝，及即位，斷丙戎父足，而使丙戎仆。

translations.literal: Yi Gong fourth year spring, initially, Yi Gong as duke son time, with Bing Rong father hunted, contended catch not win, and ascended throne, cut Bing Rong father feet, and made Bing Rong servant.
translations.idiomatic: In Yi Gong's fourth year spring, initially, when Yi Gong was a duke son, he hunted with Bing Rong's father; contended over the catch and did not win; when he ascended the throne, he cut off Bing Rong's father's feet; and made Bing Rong a servant.

sentences.zh: 庸職之妻好，公內之宮，使庸職驂乘。

translations.literal: Yong Zhi wife beautiful, duke took her into palace, made Yong Zhi outside driver.
translations.idiomatic: Yong Zhi's wife was beautiful; the duke took her into the palace; made Yong Zhi the outside driver.

sentences.zh: 五月，懿公游於申池，二人浴，戲。

translations.literal: Fifth month, Yi Gong toured at Shen Pool, two people bathed, played.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifth month, Yi Gong toured at Shen Pool; the two bathed and played.

sentences.zh: 職曰：「斷足子！」

translations.literal: Zhi said: 'cut feet son!'
translations.idiomatic: Zhi said: 'Son who cut off feet!'

sentences.zh: 戎曰：「奪妻者！」

translations.literal: Rong said: 'seized wife person!'
translations.idiomatic: Rong said: 'One who seized wife!'

sentences.zh: 二人俱病此言，乃怨。

translations.literal: Two people both resented these words, then resented.
translations.idiomatic: The two both resented these words; then resented.

sentences.zh: 謀與公游竹中，二人弒懿公車上，棄竹中而亡去。

translations.literal: Plotted with duke toured bamboo middle, two assassinated Yi Gong chariot on, abandoned bamboo middle and fled.
translations.idiomatic: They plotted to tour with the duke in the bamboo grove; the two assassinated Yi Gong on the chariot; abandoned him in the bamboo grove and fled.

sentences.zh: 懿公之立，驕，民不附。

translations.literal: Yi Gong established, arrogant, people not attached.
translations.idiomatic: When Yi Gong was established, he was arrogant; the people did not attach to him.

sentences.zh: 齊人廢其子而迎公子元於衛，立之，是為惠公。

translations.literal: Qi people abolished his son and welcomed duke son Yuan from Wei, established him, this was Hui Gong.
translations.idiomatic: The Qi people abolished his son and welcomed duke son Yuan from Wei; established him; this was Hui Gong.

sentences.zh: 惠公，桓公子也。

translations.literal: Hui Gong, Huan Gong son also.
translations.idiomatic: Hui Gong was Huan Gong's son.

sentences.zh: 其母衛女，曰少衛姬，避齊亂，故在衛。

translations.literal: His mother Wei woman, called Shao Wei Ji, avoided Qi chaos, therefore in Wei.
translations.idiomatic: His mother was a Wei woman, called Shao Wei Ji; she avoided Qi's chaos; therefore was in Wei.

sentences.zh: 惠公二年，長翟來，王子城父攻殺之，埋之於北門。

translations.literal: Hui Gong second year, Chang Di came, Wang Zi Cheng Fu attacked killed him, buried him at north gate.
translations.idiomatic: In Hui Gong's second year, Chang Di came; Wang Zi Cheng Fu attacked and killed him; buried him at the north gate.

sentences.zh: 晉趙穿弒其君靈公。

translations.literal: Jin Zhao Chuan assassinated his lord Ling Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Jin Zhao Chuan assassinated his lord Ling Gong.

sentences.zh: 十年，惠公卒，子頃公無野立。

translations.literal: Tenth year, Hui Gong died, son Qing Gong Wu Ye established.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth year, Hui Gong died; his son Qing Gong Wu Ye was established.

sentences.zh: 初，崔杼有寵於惠公，惠公卒，高、國畏其偪也，逐之，崔杼奔衛。

translations.literal: Initially, Cui Zhu had favor with Hui Gong, Hui Gong died, Gao, Guo feared his oppression, expelled him, Cui Zhu fled Wei.
translations.idiomatic: Initially, Cui Zhu had favor with Hui Gong; Hui Gong died; Gao and Guo feared his oppression; expelled him; Cui Zhu fled to Wei.

sentences.zh: 頃公元年，楚莊王彊，伐陳；

translations.literal: Qing Gong first year, Chu Zhuang Wang strong, attacked Chen;
translations.idiomatic: In Qing Gong's first year, Chu Zhuang Wang was strong; attacked Chen;

sentences.zh: 二年，圍鄭，鄭伯降，已復國鄭伯。

translations.literal: Second year, surrounded Zheng, Zheng Bo surrendered, then restored state Zheng Bo.
translations.idiomatic: In the second year, surrounded Zheng; Zheng Bo surrendered; then restored Zheng Bo's state.

sentences.zh: 六年春，晉使郤克於齊，齊使夫人帷中而觀之。

translations.literal: Sixth year spring, Jin sent Xi Ke to Qi, Qi made consort curtain middle observe him.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixth year spring, Jin sent Xi Ke to Qi; Qi made the consort observe him from behind a curtain.

sentences.zh: 郤克上，夫人笑之。

translations.literal: Xi Ke ascended, consort laughed at him.
translations.idiomatic: Xi Ke ascended; the consort laughed at him.

sentences.zh: 郤克曰：「不是報，不復涉河！」

translations.literal: Xi Ke said: 'If not avenge, not again cross river!'
translations.idiomatic: Xi Ke said: 'If not avenge this, I will not cross the river again!'

sentences.zh: 歸，請伐齊，晉侯弗許。

translations.literal: Returned, requested attack Qi, Jin Hou not permitted.
translations.idiomatic: He returned; requested to attack Qi; Jin Hou did not permit it.

sentences.zh: 齊使至晉，郤克執齊使者四人河內，殺之。

translations.literal: Qi envoy arrived Jin, Xi Ke seized Qi envoys four people river inner, killed them.
translations.idiomatic: Qi envoy arrived at Jin; Xi Ke seized four Qi envoys within the river area; killed them.

sentences.zh: 八年。

translations.literal: Eighth year.
translations.idiomatic: Eighth year.

sentences.zh: 晉伐齊，齊以公子彊質晉，晉兵去。

translations.literal: Jin attacked Qi, Qi with duke son Qiang hostage Jin, Jin troops left.
translations.idiomatic: Jin attacked Qi; Qi gave duke son Qiang as hostage to Jin; Jin troops left.

sentences.zh: 十年春，齊伐魯、衛。

translations.literal: Tenth year spring, Qi attacked Lu, Wei.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth year spring, Qi attacked Lu and Wei.

sentences.zh: 魯、衛大夫如晉請師，皆因郤克。

translations.literal: Lu, Wei grand masters went to Jin requested troops, all through Xi Ke.
translations.idiomatic: Lu and Wei grand masters went to Jin to request troops; all went through Xi Ke.

sentences.zh: 晉使郤克以車八百乘為中軍將，士燮將上軍，欒書將下軍，以救魯、衛，伐齊。

translations.literal: Jin sent Xi Ke with chariots eight hundred as middle army general, Shi Xie general upper army, Luan Shu general lower army, to save Lu, Wei, attack Qi.
translations.idiomatic: Jin sent Xi Ke with eight hundred chariots as middle army general; Shi Xie as upper army general; Luan Shu as lower army general; to save Lu and Wei; attack Qi.

sentences.zh: 六月壬申，與齊侯兵合靡笄下。

translations.literal: Sixth month Ren Shen, with Qi Hou troops met Mi Ji below.
translations.idiomatic: On the sixth month Ren Shen, met with Qi Hou's troops below Mi Ji.

sentences.zh: 癸酉，陳于礱逄丑父為齊頃公右。

translations.literal: Gui You, arrayed at Long Pang Chou Fu as Qi Qing Gong right.
translations.idiomatic: On Gui You, arrayed at Long; Pang Chou Fu was Qi Qing Gong's right.

sentences.zh: 頃公曰：「馳之，破晉軍會食。」

translations.literal: Qing Gong said: 'gallop them, defeat Jin army will eat.'
translations.idiomatic: Qing Gong said: 'Gallop against them; defeat the Jin army and we will eat.'

sentences.zh: 射傷郤克，流血至履。

translations.literal: Shot injured Xi Ke, flowed blood to shoes.
translations.idiomatic: Shot and injured Xi Ke; blood flowed to his shoes.

sentences.zh: 克欲還入壁，其御曰：「我始入，再傷，不敢言疾，恐懼士卒，願子忍之。」

translations.literal: Ke wanted return enter wall, his driver said: 'I began enter, again injured, not dare speak pain, fear soldiers, wish you endure it.'
translations.idiomatic: Ke wanted to return and enter the wall; his driver said: 'I began to enter; injured again; did not dare speak of the pain; feared the soldiers; wish you endure it.'

sentences.zh: 遂復戰。

translations.literal: Then again battled.
translations.idiomatic: Then battled again.

sentences.zh: 戰，齊急，丑父恐齊侯得，乃易處，頃公為右，車絓於木而止。

translations.literal: Battled, Qi urgent, Chou Fu feared Qi Hou obtained, then changed position, Qing Gong as right, chariot tangled in wood and stopped.
translations.idiomatic: They battled; Qi was in dire straits; Chou Fu feared Qi Hou would be captured; then changed positions; Qing Gong became the right; chariot tangled in wood and stopped.

sentences.zh: 晉小將韓厥伏齊侯車前，曰「寡君使臣救魯、衛」，戲之。

translations.literal: Jin young general Han Jue hid Qi Hou chariot front, said 'my lord sent minister save Lu, Wei', mocked him.
translations.idiomatic: Jin young general Han Jue hid in front of Qi Hou's chariot; said 'my lord sent me to save Lu and Wei'; mocked him.

sentences.zh: 丑父使頃公下取飲，因得亡，脫去，入其軍。

translations.literal: Chou Fu made Qing Gong descend take drink, thereby got flee, escaped go, entered his army.
translations.idiomatic: Chou Fu made Qing Gong descend to take a drink; thereby he got to flee; escaped and went; entered his army.

sentences.zh: 晉郤克欲殺丑父。

translations.literal: Jin Xi Ke wanted kill Chou Fu.
translations.idiomatic: Jin Xi Ke wanted to kill Chou Fu.

sentences.zh: 丑父曰：「代君死而見僇，後人臣無忠其君者矣。」

translations.literal: Chou Fu said: 'substitute lord die and seen mutilated, later ministers none loyal their lords.'
translations.idiomatic: Chou Fu said: 'I died in the lord's place and was seen mutilated; later ministers will have none loyal to their lords.'

sentences.zh: 克捨之，丑父遂得亡歸齊。

translations.literal: Ke released him, Chou Fu then got flee return Qi.
translations.idiomatic: Ke released him; Chou Fu then got to flee back to Qi.

sentences.zh: 於是晉軍追齊至馬陵。

translations.literal: Therefore Jin army pursued Qi to Ma Ling.
