translations.idiomatic: Therefore Jin army pursued Qi to Ma Ling.

sentences.zh: 齊侯請以寶器謝，不聽；

translations.literal: Qi Hou requested with precious vessels apologize, not listened;
translations.idiomatic: Qi Hou requested to apologize with precious vessels; not listened to;

sentences.zh: 必得笑克者蕭桐叔子，令齊東畝。

translations.literal: must get laughed at Ke person Xiao Tong Shu Zi, ordered Qi east fields.
translations.idiomatic: must get the person who laughed at Ke - Xiao Tong Shu Zi; ordered Qi to cede eastern fields.

sentences.zh: 對曰：「叔子，齊君母。

translations.literal: Replied said: 'Shu Zi, Qi lord mother.'
translations.idiomatic: He replied: 'Shu Zi is the Qi lord's mother.'

sentences.zh: 齊君母亦猶晉君母，子安置之？

translations.literal: Qi lord mother also like Jin lord mother, you where place her?'
translations.idiomatic: The Qi lord's mother is also like the Jin lord's mother; where will you place her?'

sentences.zh: 且子以義伐而以暴為後，其可乎？」

translations.literal: Moreover you with righteousness attack but with violence as consequence, is it permissible?'
translations.idiomatic: Moreover, you attack with righteousness but take violence as the consequence; is this permissible?'

sentences.zh: 於是乃許，令反魯、衛之侵地。

translations.literal: Therefore then permitted, ordered return Lu, Wei invaded lands.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore they then permitted it; ordered the return of Lu and Wei's invaded lands.

sentences.zh: 十一年，晉初置六卿，賞鞌之功。

translations.literal: Eleventh year, Jin initially established six ministers, rewarded An battle merit.
translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh year, Jin initially established the six ministers; rewarded the merits of the An battle.

sentences.zh: 齊頃公朝晉，欲尊王晉景公，晉景公不敢受，乃歸。

translations.literal: Qi Qing Gong court Jin, wanted honor king Jin Jing Gong, Jin Jing Gong not dare accept, then returned.
translations.idiomatic: Qi Qing Gong went to court at Jin; wanted to honor-king Jin Jing Gong; Jin Jing Gong did not dare accept; then returned.

sentences.zh: 歸而頃公弛苑囿，薄賦斂，振孤問疾，虛積聚以救民，民亦大說。

translations.literal: Returned and Qing Gong relaxed parks enclosures, reduced taxes levies, aided orphans asked illnesses, emptied stores to save people, people also greatly pleased.
translations.idiomatic: After returning, Qing Gong relaxed the parks and enclosures; reduced taxes and levies; aided orphans and inquired about illnesses; emptied the stores to save the people; the people were also greatly pleased.

sentences.zh: 厚禮諸侯。

translations.literal: Thickly treated the feudal lords.
translations.idiomatic: He treated the feudal lords with great courtesy.

sentences.zh: 竟頃公卒，百姓附，諸侯不犯。

translations.literal: Throughout Qing Gong died, hundred families attached, feudal lords not violated.
translations.idiomatic: Throughout his reign, Qing Gong died; the hundred families were attached; the feudal lords did not violate.

sentences.zh: 十七年，頃公卒，子靈公環立。

translations.literal: Seventeenth year, Qing Gong died, son Ling Gong Huan established.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventeenth year, Qing Gong died; his son Ling Gong Huan was established.

sentences.zh: 靈公九年，晉欒書弒其君厲公。

translations.literal: Ling Gong ninth year, Jin Luan Shu assassinated his lord Li Gong.
translations.idiomatic: In Ling Gong's ninth year, Jin Luan Shu assassinated his lord Li Gong.

sentences.zh: 十年，晉悼公伐齊，齊令公子光質晉。

translations.literal: Tenth year, Jin Dao Gong attacked Qi, Qi ordered duke son Guang hostage Jin.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth year, Jin Dao Gong attacked Qi; Qi ordered duke son Guang to be hostage in Jin.

sentences.zh: 十九年，立子光為太子，高厚傅之，令會諸侯盟於鐘離。

translations.literal: Nineteenth year, established son Guang as crown prince, Gao Hou tutored him, ordered assemble feudal lords alliance at Zhong Li.
translations.idiomatic: In the nineteenth year, he established son Guang as crown prince; Gao Hou tutored him; ordered the assembly of feudal lords for an alliance at Zhong Li.

sentences.zh: 二十七年，晉使中行獻子伐齊。

translations.literal: Twenty-seventh year, Jin sent Zhong Xing Xian Zi attack Qi.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-seventh year, Jin sent Zhong Xing Xian Zi to attack Qi.

sentences.zh: 齊師敗，靈公走入臨菑。

translations.literal: Qi army defeated, Ling Gong fled enter Lin Zi.
translations.idiomatic: The Qi army was defeated; Ling Gong fled into Lin Zi.

sentences.zh: 晏嬰止靈公，靈公弗從。

translations.literal: Yan Ying stopped Ling Gong, Ling Gong not followed.
translations.idiomatic: Yan Ying stopped Ling Gong; Ling Gong did not follow.

sentences.zh: 曰：「君亦無勇矣！」

translations.literal: Said: 'lord also without courage!'
translations.idiomatic: He said: 'My lord also has no courage!'

sentences.zh: 晉兵遂圍臨菑，臨菑城守不敢出，晉焚郭中而去。

translations.literal: Jin troops then surrounded Lin Zi, Lin Zi city defenders not dare exit, Jin burned outer walls middle and left.
translations.idiomatic: Jin troops then surrounded Lin Zi; Lin Zi's city defenders did not dare exit; Jin burned the outer walls and left.

sentences.zh: 二十八年，初，靈公取魯女，生子光，以為太子。

translations.literal: Twenty-eighth year, initially, Ling Gong took Lu woman, gave birth son Guang, established as crown prince.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-eighth year, initially, Ling Gong took a Lu woman; gave birth to son Guang; established him as crown prince.

sentences.zh: 仲姬，戎姬。

translations.literal: Zhong Ji, Rong Ji.
translations.idiomatic: Zhong Ji, Rong Ji.

sentences.zh: 戎姬嬖，仲姬生子牙，屬之戎姬。

translations.literal: Rong Ji favored, Zhong Ji gave birth son Ya, entrusted him to Rong Ji.
translations.idiomatic: Rong Ji was favored; Zhong Ji gave birth to son Ya; entrusted him to Rong Ji.

sentences.zh: 戎姬請以為太子，公許之。

translations.literal: Rong Ji requested to establish as crown prince, duke permitted it.
translations.idiomatic: Rong Ji requested to establish him as crown prince; the duke permitted it.

sentences.zh: 仲姬曰：「不可。

translations.literal: Zhong Ji said: 'not permissible.'
translations.idiomatic: Zhong Ji said: 'This is not permissible.'

sentences.zh: 光之立，列於諸侯矣，今無故廢之，君必悔之。」

translations.literal: Guang established, ranked among feudal lords, now without cause abolish him, lord certainly will regret it.'
translations.idiomatic: Guang has been established; ranked among the feudal lords; now without cause to abolish him; my lord will certainly regret it.'

sentences.zh: 公曰：「在我耳。」

translations.literal: Duke said: 'in my hands.'
translations.idiomatic: The duke said: 'It is in my hands.'

sentences.zh: 遂東太子光，使高厚傅牙為太子。

translations.literal: Then sent east crown prince Guang, made Gao Hou tutor Ya as crown prince.
translations.idiomatic: Then he sent crown prince Guang east; made Gao Hou tutor Ya as crown prince.

sentences.zh: 靈公疾，崔杼迎故太子光而立之，是為莊公。

translations.literal: Ling Gong ill, Cui Zhu welcomed former crown prince Guang and established him, this was Zhuang Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Ling Gong fell ill; Cui Zhu welcomed the former crown prince Guang and established him; this was Zhuang Gong.

sentences.zh: 莊公殺戎姬。

translations.literal: Zhuang Gong killed Rong Ji.
translations.idiomatic: Zhuang Gong killed Rong Ji.

sentences.zh: 五月壬辰，靈公卒，莊公即位，執太子牙於句竇之丘，殺之。

translations.literal: Fifth month Ren Chen, Ling Gong died, Zhuang Gong ascended throne, seized crown prince Ya at Gou Dou hill, killed him.
translations.idiomatic: On the fifth month Ren Chen, Ling Gong died; Zhuang Gong ascended the throne; seized crown prince Ya at Gou Dou hill; killed him.

sentences.zh: 八月，崔杼殺高厚。

translations.literal: Eighth month, Cui Zhu killed Gao Hou.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighth month, Cui Zhu killed Gao Hou.

sentences.zh: 晉聞齊亂，伐齊，至高唐。

translations.literal: Jin heard Qi chaos, attacked Qi, arrived Gao Tang.
translations.idiomatic: Jin heard of Qi's chaos; attacked Qi; arrived at Gao Tang.

sentences.zh: 莊公三年，晉大夫欒盈奔齊，莊公厚客待之。

translations.literal: Zhuang Gong third year, Jin grand master Luan Ying fled Qi, Zhuang Gong thickly treated as guest.
translations.idiomatic: In Zhuang Gong's third year, Jin grand master Luan Ying fled to Qi; Zhuang Gong treated him generously as a guest.

sentences.zh: 晏嬰、田文子諫，公弗聽。

translations.literal: Yan Ying, Tian Wen Zi admonished, duke not listened.
translations.idiomatic: Yan Ying and Tian Wen Zi admonished; the duke did not listen.

sentences.zh: 四年，齊莊公使欒盈閒入晉曲沃為內應，以兵隨之，上太行，入孟門。

translations.literal: Fourth year, Qi Zhuang Gong sent Luan Ying secretly enter Jin Qu Wo as internal support, with troops followed him, ascended Tai Hang, entered Meng Men.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth year, Qi Zhuang Gong sent Luan Ying to secretly enter Jin Qu Wo as internal support; with troops following him; ascended Tai Hang; entered Meng Men.

sentences.zh: 欒盈敗，齊兵還，取朝歌。

translations.literal: Luan Ying defeated, Qi troops returned, took Zhao Ge.
translations.idiomatic: Luan Ying was defeated; Qi troops returned; took Zhao Ge.

sentences.zh: 六年，初，棠公妻好，棠公死，崔杼取之。

translations.literal: Sixth year, initially, Tang Gong wife beautiful, Tang Gong died, Cui Zhu took her.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixth year, initially, Tang Gong's wife was beautiful; Tang Gong died; Cui Zhu took her.

sentences.zh: 莊公通之，數如崔氏，以崔杼之冠賜人。

translations.literal: Zhuang Gong had relations with her, frequently went to Cui clan, with Cui Zhu hat bestowed people.
translations.idiomatic: Zhuang Gong had relations with her; frequently went to the Cui clan; bestowed Cui Zhu's hat on people.

sentences.zh: 待者曰：「不可。」

translations.literal: Attendant said: 'not permissible.'
translations.idiomatic: The attendant said: 'This is not permissible.'

sentences.zh: 崔杼怒，因其伐晉，欲與晉合謀襲齊而不得閒。

translations.literal: Cui Zhu angered, took advantage his attack Jin, wanted with Jin jointly plot attack Qi but not get opportunity.
translations.idiomatic: Cui Zhu was angered; took advantage of his attack on Jin; wanted to jointly plot with Jin to attack Qi but did not get the opportunity.

sentences.zh: 莊公嘗笞宦者賈舉，賈舉復侍，為崔杼閒公以報怨。

translations.literal: Zhuang Gong once whipped eunuch Jia Ju, Jia Ju again served, for Cui Zhu spied duke to avenge grudge.
translations.idiomatic: Zhuang Gong once whipped the eunuch Jia Ju; Jia Ju again served; spied on the duke for Cui Zhu to avenge the grudge.

sentences.zh: 五月，莒子朝齊，齊以甲戌饗之。

translations.literal: Fifth month, Ju Zi court Qi, Qi with Jia Xu feasted him.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifth month, Ju Zi came to court Qi; Qi feasted him on Jia Xu.

sentences.zh: 崔杼稱病不視事。

translations.literal: Cui Zhu claimed illness not handled affairs.
translations.idiomatic: Cui Zhu claimed illness and did not handle affairs.

sentences.zh: 乙亥，公問崔杼病，遂從崔杼妻。

translations.literal: Yi Hai, duke inquired Cui Zhu illness, then followed Cui Zhu wife.
translations.idiomatic: On Yi Hai, the duke inquired about Cui Zhu's illness; then followed Cui Zhu's wife.

sentences.zh: 崔杼妻入室，與崔杼自閉戶不出，公擁柱而歌。

translations.literal: Cui Zhu wife entered chamber, with Cui Zhu self closed door not exited, duke embraced pillar and sang.
translations.idiomatic: Cui Zhu's wife entered the chamber; with Cui Zhu they self-closed the door and did not exit; the duke embraced the pillar and sang.

sentences.zh: 宦者賈舉遮公從官而入，閉門，崔杼之徒持兵從中起。

translations.literal: Eunuch Jia Ju blocked duke followers and entered, closed door, Cui Zhu followers held weapons from middle rose.
translations.idiomatic: The eunuch Jia Ju blocked the duke's followers and entered; closed the door; Cui Zhu's followers held weapons and rose from the middle.

sentences.zh: 公登臺而請解，不許；

translations.literal: Duke ascended platform and requested reconciliation, not permitted;
translations.idiomatic: The duke ascended the platform and requested reconciliation; not permitted;

sentences.zh: 請盟，不許；

translations.literal: requested alliance, not permitted;
translations.idiomatic: requested alliance; not permitted;

sentences.zh: 請自殺於廟，不許。

translations.literal: requested suicide in temple, not permitted.
translations.idiomatic: Requested to commit suicide in the temple; not permitted.

sentences.zh: 皆曰：「君之臣杼疾病，不能聽命。

translations.literal: All said: 'lord minister Zhu illness, cannot listen commands.'
translations.idiomatic: All said: 'Your lord's minister Zhu has illness; cannot listen to commands.'

sentences.zh: 近於公宮。

translations.literal: Close to duke palace.
translations.idiomatic: Close to the duke's palace.

sentences.zh: 陪臣爭趣有淫者，不知二命。」

translations.literal: Attendant ministers contended rushed had licentious ones, not know two commands.'
translations.idiomatic: Attendant ministers contended and rushed to those who had licentious ones; do not know the two commands.'

sentences.zh: 公踰墻，射中公股，公反墜，遂弒之。

translations.literal: Duke leaped wall, shot hit duke thigh, duke back fell, then assassinated him.
translations.idiomatic: The duke leaped the wall; shot hit the duke's thigh; the duke fell back; then assassinated him.

sentences.zh: 晏嬰立崔杼門外，曰：「君為社稷死則死之，為社稷亡則亡之。

translations.literal: Yan Ying stood Cui Zhu gate outside, said: 'lord for altars soil die then die for him, for altars soil flee then flee for him.'
translations.idiomatic: Yan Ying stood outside Cui Zhu's gate; said: 'If the lord dies for the altars and soil then die for him; if the lord flees for the altars and soil then flee for him.'

sentences.zh: 若為己死己亡，非其私暱，誰敢任之！」

translations.literal: If for self die self flee, not his private intimates, who dare undertake it!'
translations.idiomatic: If he dies or flees for himself; not his private intimates; who would dare undertake it!'

sentences.zh: 門開而入，枕公尸而哭，三踴而出。

translations.literal: Gate opened and entered, pillowed duke corpse and cried, three leaps and exited.
translations.idiomatic: The gate opened and he entered; pillowed the duke's corpse and cried; leaped three times and exited.

sentences.zh: 人謂崔杼：「必殺之。」

translations.literal: People said to Cui Zhu: 'must kill him.'
translations.idiomatic: People said to Cui Zhu: 'You must kill him.'

sentences.zh: 崔杼曰：「民之望也，捨之得民。」

translations.literal: Cui Zhu said: 'people hope, release him get people.'
translations.idiomatic: Cui Zhu said: 'He is the people's hope; release him and gain the people.'

sentences.zh: 丁丑，崔杼立莊公異母弟杵臼，是為景公。

translations.literal: Ding Chou, Cui Zhu established Zhuang Gong different mother younger brother Chu Jiu, this was Jing Gong.
translations.idiomatic: On Ding Chou, Cui Zhu established Zhuang Gong's different mother younger brother Chu Jiu; this was Jing Gong.

sentences.zh: 景公母，魯叔孫宣伯女也。

translations.literal: Jing Gong mother, Lu Shu Sun Xuan Bo daughter also.
translations.idiomatic: Jing Gong's mother was Lu Shu Sun Xuan Bo's daughter.

sentences.zh: 景公立，以崔杼為右相，慶封為左相。

translations.literal: Jing Gong established, with Cui Zhu as right minister, Qing Feng as left minister.
translations.idiomatic: Jing Gong was established; with Cui Zhu as right minister; Qing Feng as left minister.

sentences.zh: 二相恐亂起，乃與國人盟曰：「不與崔慶者死！」

translations.literal: Two ministers feared chaos arise, then with state people alliance said: 'not with Cui Qing ones die!'
translations.idiomatic: The two ministers feared chaos would arise; then made alliance with the state people saying: 'Those who do not side with Cui and Qing will die!'

sentences.zh: 晏子仰天曰：「嬰所不（獲）唯忠於君利社稷者是從！」

translations.literal: Yan Zi faced heaven said: 'Ying what not obtain only loyal to lord benefit altars soil ones is follow!'
translations.idiomatic: Yan Zi faced heaven and said: 'What Ying will not obtain is only to follow those loyal to the lord and beneficial to the altars and soil!'

sentences.zh: 不肯盟。

translations.literal: not willing alliance.
translations.idiomatic: Not willing to make the alliance.

sentences.zh: 慶封欲殺晏子，崔杼曰：「忠臣也，捨之。」

translations.literal: Qing Feng wanted kill Yan Zi, Cui Zhu said: 'loyal minister, release him.'
translations.idiomatic: Qing Feng wanted to kill Yan Zi; Cui Zhu said: 'He is a loyal minister; release him.'

sentences.zh: 齊太史書曰「崔杼弒莊公」，崔杼殺之。

translations.literal: Qi grand scribe wrote said 'Cui Zhu assassinated Zhuang Gong', Cui Zhu killed him.
translations.idiomatic: Qi grand scribe wrote: 'Cui Zhu assassinated Zhuang Gong'; Cui Zhu killed him.

sentences.zh: 其弟復書，崔杼復殺之。

translations.literal: His younger brother again wrote, Cui Zhu again killed him.
translations.idiomatic: His younger brother again wrote it; Cui Zhu again killed him.

sentences.zh: 少弟復書，崔杼乃捨之。

translations.literal: Younger brother again wrote, Cui Zhu then released him.
translations.idiomatic: The younger brother again wrote it; Cui Zhu then released him.

sentences.zh: 景公元年，初，崔杼生子成及彊，其母死，取東郭女，生明。

translations.literal: Jing Gong first year, initially, Cui Zhu gave birth sons Cheng and Qiang, their mother died, took Dong Guo woman, gave birth Ming.
translations.idiomatic: In Jing Gong's first year, initially, Cui Zhu had sons Cheng and Qiang; their mother died; took a Dong Guo woman; gave birth to Ming.

sentences.zh: 東郭女使其前夫子無咎與其弟偃相崔氏。

translations.literal: Dong Guo woman made her former husband Zi Wu Jiu and her younger brother Yan assist Cui clan.
translations.idiomatic: The Dong Guo woman made her former husband Zi Wu Jiu and her younger brother Yan assist the Cui clan.

sentences.zh: 成有罪，二相急治之，立明為太子。

translations.literal: Cheng had crime, two ministers urgently punished him, established Ming as crown prince.
translations.idiomatic: Cheng had a crime; the two ministers urgently punished him; established Ming as crown prince.

sentences.zh: 成請老於崔［杼］，崔杼許之，二相弗聽，曰：「崔，宗邑，不可。」

translations.literal: Cheng requested retire in Cui [Zhu], Cui Zhu permitted it, two ministers not listened, said: 'Cui, ancestral city, not permissible.'
translations.idiomatic: Cheng requested to retire in Cui [Zhu]; Cui Zhu permitted it; the two ministers did not listen; said: 'Cui is an ancestral city; not permissible.'

sentences.zh: 成、彊怒，告慶封。

translations.literal: Cheng, Qiang angered, told Qing Feng.
translations.idiomatic: Cheng and Qiang were angered; told Qing Feng.

sentences.zh: 慶封與崔杼有郤，欲其敗也。

translations.literal: Qing Feng with Cui Zhu had enmity, wanted his defeat.
translations.idiomatic: Qing Feng had enmity with Cui Zhu; wanted his defeat.

sentences.zh: 成、彊殺無咎、偃於崔杼家，家皆奔亡。

translations.literal: Cheng, Qiang killed Wu Jiu, Yan at Cui Zhu home, household all fled escaped.
translations.idiomatic: Cheng and Qiang killed Wu Jiu and Yan at Cui Zhu's home; the household all fled and escaped.

sentences.zh: 崔杼怒，無人，使一宦者御，見慶封。

translations.literal: Cui Zhu angered, no people, made one eunuch drive, saw Qing Feng.
translations.idiomatic: Cui Zhu was angered; had no people; made one eunuch drive; saw Qing Feng.

sentences.zh: 慶封曰：「請為子誅之。」

translations.literal: Qing Feng said: 'please for you exterminate them.'
translations.idiomatic: Qing Feng said: 'Please let me exterminate them for you.'

sentences.zh: 使崔杼仇盧蒲嫳攻崔氏，殺成、彊，盡滅崔氏，崔杼婦自殺。

translations.literal: Made Cui Zhu enemy Lu Pu Bi attack Cui clan, killed Cheng, Qiang, completely exterminated Cui clan, Cui Zhu wife committed suicide.
translations.idiomatic: Made Cui Zhu's enemy Lu Pu Bi attack the Cui clan; killed Cheng and Qiang; completely exterminated the Cui clan; Cui Zhu's wife committed suicide.

sentences.zh: 崔杼毋歸，亦自殺。

translations.literal: Cui Zhu mother return, also committed suicide.
translations.idiomatic: Cui Zhu's mother had no place to return to; also committed suicide.

sentences.zh: 慶封為相國，專權。

translations.literal: Qing Feng became chancellor, monopolized power.
translations.idiomatic: Qing Feng became chancellor; monopolized power.

sentences.zh: 三年十月，慶封出獵。

translations.literal: Third year tenth month, Qing Feng went hunting.
translations.idiomatic: In the third year tenth month, Qing Feng went hunting.

sentences.zh: 初，慶封已殺崔杼，益驕，嗜酒好獵，不聽政令。

translations.literal: Initially, Qing Feng already killed Cui Zhu, increasingly arrogant, addicted wine fond hunting, not listened government commands.
translations.idiomatic: Initially, Qing Feng had already killed Cui Zhu; increasingly arrogant; addicted to wine and fond of hunting; did not listen to government commands.

sentences.zh: 慶舍用政，已有內郤。

translations.literal: Qing She administered government, already had internal enmity.
translations.idiomatic: Qing She administered the government; already had internal enmity.

sentences.zh: 田文子謂桓子曰：「亂將作。」

translations.literal: Tian Wen Zi told Jian Zi said: 'chaos will arise.'
translations.idiomatic: Tian Wen Zi told Jian Zi: 'Chaos will arise.'

sentences.zh: 田、鮑、高、欒氏相與謀慶氏。

translations.literal: Tian, Bao, Gao, Luan clans mutually plotted Qing clan.
translations.idiomatic: Tian, Bao, Gao, and Luan clans mutually plotted against the Qing clan.

sentences.zh: 慶舍發甲圍慶封宮，四家徒共擊破之。

translations.literal: Qing She sent armor surrounded Qing Feng palace, four families followers together attacked broke it.
translations.idiomatic: Qing She sent armed men to surround Qing Feng's palace; the four families' followers together attacked and broke it.

sentences.zh: 慶封還，不得入，奔魯。

translations.literal: Qing Feng returned, not able enter, fled Lu.
translations.idiomatic: Qing Feng returned; not able to enter; fled to Lu.

sentences.zh: 齊人讓魯，封奔吳。

translations.literal: Qi people blamed Lu, Feng fled Wu.
translations.idiomatic: Qi people blamed Lu; Feng fled to Wu.

sentences.zh: 吳與之朱方，聚其族而居之，富於在齊。

translations.literal: Wu gave him Zhu Fang, gathered his clan and resided there, wealthy than in Qi.
translations.idiomatic: Wu gave him Zhu Fang; gathered his clan and resided there; was wealthier than in Qi.

sentences.zh: 其秋，齊人徙葬莊公，僇崔杼尸於市以說眾。

translations.literal: That autumn, Qi people moved buried Zhuang Gong, mutilated Cui Zhu corpse in market to please masses.
translations.idiomatic: That autumn, Qi people moved and buried Zhuang Gong; mutilated Cui Zhu's corpse in the market to please the masses.

sentences.zh: 九年，景公使晏嬰之晉，與叔向私語曰：「齊政卒歸田氏。

translations.literal: Ninth year, Jing Gong sent Yan Ying to Jin, with Shu Xiang private conversation said: 'Qi government finally returned Tian clan.'
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth year, Jing Gong sent Yan Ying to Jin; had a private conversation with Shu Xiang: 'Qi government has finally returned to the Tian clan.'

sentences.zh: 田氏雖無大德，以公權私，有德於民，民愛之。」

translations.literal: Tian clan though no great virtue, with public power private, had virtue to people, people loved them.'
translations.idiomatic: The Tian clan though has no great virtue; uses public power for private gain; has virtue toward the people; the people love them.'

sentences.zh: 十二年，景公如晉，見平公，欲與伐燕。

translations.literal: Twelfth year, Jing Gong went to Jin, saw Ping Gong, wanted with him attack Yan.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth year, Jing Gong went to Jin; saw Ping Gong; wanted to attack Yan with him.

sentences.zh: 十八年，公復如晉，見昭公。

translations.literal: Eighteenth year, duke again went to Jin, saw Zhao Gong.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighteenth year, the duke again went to Jin; saw Zhao Gong.

sentences.zh: 二十六年，獵魯郊，因入魯，與晏嬰俱問魯禮。

translations.literal: Twenty-sixth year, hunted Lu suburbs, thereby entered Lu, with Yan Ying together inquired Lu rites.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-sixth year, hunted in Lu's suburbs; thereby entered Lu; together with Yan Ying inquired about Lu's rites.

sentences.zh: 三十一年，魯昭公辟季氏難，奔齊。

translations.literal: Thirty-first year, Lu Zhao Gong avoided Ji clan difficulty, fled Qi.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-first year, Lu Zhao Gong avoided the Ji clan's difficulty; fled to Qi.

sentences.zh: 齊欲以千社封之，子家止昭公，昭公乃請齊伐魯，取鄆以居昭公。

translations.literal: Qi wanted with thousand she enfeoff him, Zi Jia stopped Zhao Gong, Zhao Gong then requested Qi attack Lu, take Yun to reside Zhao Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Qi wanted to enfeoff him with a thousand she; Zi Jia stopped Zhao Gong; Zhao Gong then requested Qi attack Lu; take Yun to reside Zhao Gong.

sentences.zh: 三十二年，彗星見。

translations.literal: Thirty-second year, comet appeared.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-second year, a comet appeared.

sentences.zh: 景公坐柏寢，嘆曰：「堂堂！

translations.literal: Jing Gong sat cypress chamber, sighed said: 'grand grand!'
translations.idiomatic: Jing Gong sat in the cypress chamber; sighed and said: "So grand!"

sentences.zh: 誰有此乎？」

translations.literal: who has this?'
translations.idiomatic: Who has this?'

sentences.zh: 群臣皆泣，晏子笑，公怒。

translations.literal: Group ministers all wept, Yan Zi laughed, duke angered.
translations.idiomatic: The group of ministers all wept; Yan Zi laughed; the duke was angered.

sentences.zh: 晏子曰：「臣笑群臣諛甚。」

translations.literal: Yan Zi said: 'minister laughs group ministers flattery excessive.'
translations.idiomatic: Yan Zi said: 'I laugh at the ministers' excessive flattery.'

sentences.zh: 景公曰：「彗星出東北，當齊分野，寡人以為憂。」

translations.literal: Jing Gong said: 'comet appears northeast, corresponds Qi star field, I take as worry.'
translations.idiomatic: Jing Gong said: 'The comet appears in the northeast; corresponds to Qi's star field; I take it as worry.'

sentences.zh: 晏子曰：「君高臺深池，賦斂如弗得，刑罰恐弗勝，茀星將出，彗星何懼乎？」

translations.literal: Yan Zi said: 'lord high towers deep pools, taxes levies as not obtained, punishments fear not sufficient, Fu star will appear, comet what fear?'
translations.idiomatic: Yan Zi said: 'My lord has high towers and deep pools; taxes and levies as if not obtained; punishments fear are not sufficient; the Fu star will appear; why fear the comet?'

sentences.zh: 公曰：「可禳否？」

translations.literal: Duke said: 'can exorcise?'
translations.idiomatic: The duke said: 'Can it be exorcised?'

sentences.zh: 晏子曰：「使神可祝而來，亦可禳而去也。

translations.literal: Yan Zi said: 'if spirits can be prayed come, also can be exorcised leave.'
translations.idiomatic: Yan Zi said: 'If spirits can be prayed to come; they can also be exorcised to leave.'

sentences.zh: 百姓苦怨以萬數，而君令一人禳之，安能勝眾口乎？」

translations.literal: hundred families bitter resentment in ten thousands count, and lord commands one person exorcise it, how can overcome many mouths?'
translations.idiomatic: The hundred families' bitter resentment counts in ten thousands; and my lord commands one person to exorcise it; how can this overcome many mouths?'

sentences.zh: 是時景公好治宮室，聚狗馬，奢侈，厚賦重刑，故晏子以此諫之。

translations.literal: At this time Jing Gong fond administered palaces, gathered dogs horses, extravagant, heavy taxes severe punishments, therefore Yan Zi with this admonished him.
translations.idiomatic: At this time, Jing Gong was fond of administering palaces; gathered dogs and horses; was extravagant; had heavy taxes and severe punishments; therefore Yan Zi admonished him with this.

sentences.zh: 四十二年，吳王闔閭伐楚，入郢。

translations.literal: Forty-second year, Wu king He Lu attacked Chu, entered Ying.
translations.idiomatic: In the forty-second year, Wu king He Lu attacked Chu; entered Ying.

sentences.zh: 四十七年，魯陽虎攻其君，不勝，奔齊，請齊伐魯。

translations.literal: Forty-seventh year, Lu Yang Hu attacked his lord, not victorious, fled Qi, requested Qi attack Lu.
translations.idiomatic: In the forty-seventh year, Lu Yang Hu attacked his lord; was not victorious; fled to Qi; requested Qi attack Lu.

sentences.zh: 鮑子諫景公，乃囚陽虎。

translations.literal: Bao Zi admonished Jing Gong, then imprisoned Yang Hu.
translations.idiomatic: Bao Zi admonished Jing Gong; then imprisoned Yang Hu.

sentences.zh: 陽虎得亡，奔晉。

translations.literal: Yang Hu got escape, fled Jin.
translations.idiomatic: Yang Hu got away; fled to Jin.

sentences.zh: 四十八年，與魯定公好會夾谷。

translations.literal: Forty-eighth year, with Lu Ding Gong friendly meeting Jia Gu.
translations.idiomatic: In the forty-eighth year, with Lu Ding Gong had a friendly meeting at Jia Gu.

sentences.zh: 犁鉏曰：「孔丘知禮而怯，請令萊人為樂，因執魯君，可得志。」

translations.literal: Li Chu said: 'Kong Qiu knows rites but cowardly, please command Lai people make music, thereby seize Lu lord, can obtain ambition.'
translations.idiomatic: Li Chu said: 'Kong Qiu knows rites but is cowardly; please command the Lai people to make music; thereby seize the Lu lord; can obtain our ambition.'

sentences.zh: 景公害孔丘相魯，懼其霸，故從犁鉏之計。

translations.literal: Jing Gong hated Kong Qiu assisted Lu, feared his hegemony, therefore followed Li Chu plan.
translations.idiomatic: Jing Gong hated that Kong Qiu assisted Lu; feared his hegemony; therefore followed Li Chu's plan.

sentences.zh: 方會，進萊樂，孔子歷階上，使有司執萊人斬之，以禮讓景公。

translations.literal: Just meeting, advanced Lai music, Kong Zi ascended stairs, made officials seize Lai people behead them, with rites yield Jing Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Just as the meeting began; advanced the Lai music; Kong Zi ascended the stairs; made the officials seize the Lai people and behead them; with rites yielded to Jing Gong.

sentences.zh: 景公慚，乃歸魯侵地以謝，而罷去。

translations.literal: Jing Gong ashamed, then returned Lu invaded lands to apologize, and departed.
translations.idiomatic: Jing Gong was ashamed; then returned Lu's invaded lands to apologize; and departed.

sentences.zh: 是歲，晏嬰卒。

translations.literal: This year, Yan Ying died.
translations.idiomatic: This year, Yan Ying died.

sentences.zh: 五十五年，范、中行反其君於晉，晉攻之急，來請粟。

translations.literal: Fifty-fifth year, Fan, Zhong Xing rebelled their lord in Jin, Jin attacked them urgently, came request grain.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifty-fifth year, Fan and Zhong Xing rebelled against their lord in Jin; Jin attacked them urgently; came to request grain.

sentences.zh: 田乞欲為亂，樹黨於逆臣，說景公曰：「范、中行數有德於齊，不可不救。」

translations.literal: Tian Qi wanted make chaos, established party among rebellious ministers, persuaded Jing Gong said: 'Fan, Zhong Xing repeatedly had virtue toward Qi, cannot not save.'
translations.idiomatic: Tian Qi wanted to make chaos; established a party among the rebellious ministers; persuaded Jing Gong: 'Fan and Zhong Xing repeatedly had virtue toward Qi; cannot not save them.'

sentences.zh: 及使乞救而輸之粟。

translations.literal: And made Qi save and transported grain to them.
translations.idiomatic: And made Qi save them and transported grain to them.

sentences.zh: 五十八年夏，景公夫人燕姬適子死。

translations.literal: Fifty-eighth year summer, Jing Gong lady Yan Ji legitimate son died.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifty-eighth year summer, Jing Gong's lady Yan Ji's legitimate son died.

sentences.zh: 景公寵妾芮姬生子荼，荼少，其母賤，無行，諸大夫恐其為嗣，乃言願擇諸子長賢者為太子。

translations.literal: Jing Gong favored concubine Rui Ji gave birth son Tu, Tu young, his mother base, no conduct, various grand masters feared him as successor, then said wished select various sons eldest worthy one as crown prince.
translations.idiomatic: Jing Gong's favored concubine Rui Ji gave birth to son Tu; Tu was young; his mother was base and had no conduct; the various grand masters feared him as successor; then said they wished to select the eldest worthy one among the various sons as crown prince.

sentences.zh: 景公老，惡言嗣事，又愛荼母，欲立之，憚發之口，乃謂諸大夫曰：「為樂耳，國何患無君乎？」

translations.literal: Jing Gong old, hated speak succession matters, also loved Tu mother, wanted establish him, dreaded speak it, then told various grand masters said: 'for pleasure only, state what worry no lord?'
translations.idiomatic: Jing Gong was old; hated to speak of succession matters; also loved Tu's mother; wanted to establish him; dreaded to speak it; then told the various grand masters: 'It is for pleasure only; why should the state worry about having no lord?'

sentences.zh: 秋，景公病，命國惠子、高昭子立少子荼為太子，逐群公子，遷之萊。

translations.literal: Autumn, Jing Gong ill, commanded Guo Hui Zi, Gao Zhao Zi establish youngest son Tu as crown prince, expelled group duke sons, moved them to Lai.
translations.idiomatic: In autumn, Jing Gong fell ill; commanded Guo Hui Zi and Gao Zhao Zi to establish youngest son Tu as crown prince; expelled the group of duke sons; moved them to Lai.

sentences.zh: 景公卒，太子荼立，是為晏孺子。

translations.literal: Jing Gong died, crown prince Tu established, this was Yan Ru Zi.
translations.idiomatic: Jing Gong died; crown prince Tu was established; this was Yan Ru Zi.

sentences.zh: 冬，未葬，而群公子畏誅，皆出亡。

translations.literal: Winter, not yet buried, and group duke sons feared execution, all fled.
translations.idiomatic: In winter, not yet buried, and the group of duke sons feared execution; all fled.

sentences.zh: 荼諸異母兄公子壽、駒、黔奔衛，公子駔、陽生奔魯。

translations.literal: Tu various different mother elder brothers duke son Shou, Ju, Qian fled Wei, duke son Zhu, Yang Sheng fled Lu.
translations.idiomatic: Tu's various different mother elder brothers - duke son Shou, Ju, Qian - fled to Wei; duke son Zhu and Yang Sheng fled to Lu.

sentences.zh: 萊人歌之曰：「景公死乎弗與埋，三軍事乎弗與謀，師乎師乎，胡黨之乎？」

translations.literal: Lai people sang it said: 'Jing Gong died not with bury, three armies matters not with plan, army army, why follow him?'
translations.idiomatic: The Lai people sang it: 'Jing Gong died; not with bury; three armies matters; not with plan; army, army, why follow him?'

sentences.zh: 晏孺子元年春，田乞偽事高、國者，每朝，乞驂乘，言曰：「子得君，大夫皆自危，欲謀作亂。」

translations.literal: Yan Ru Zi first year spring, Tian Qi falsely served Gao, Guo ones, every court, Qi outside driver, said: 'you got lord, grand masters all self danger, want plot make chaos.'
translations.idiomatic: In Yan Ru Zi's first year spring, Tian Qi falsely served the Gao and Guo ones; every court session; Qi was the outside driver; said: 'You got the lord; the grand masters all endanger themselves; want to plot to make chaos.'

sentences.zh: 又謂諸大夫曰：「高昭子可畏，及未發，先之。」

translations.literal: Also told various grand masters said: 'Gao Zhao Zi can fear, and not yet issued, first him.'
translations.idiomatic: Also told the various grand masters: 'Gao Zhao Zi can be feared; and before he issues, strike first.'

sentences.zh: 大夫從之。

translations.literal: Grand masters followed it.
translations.idiomatic: The grand masters followed it.

sentences.zh: 六月，田乞、鮑牧乃與大夫以兵入公宮，攻高昭子。

translations.literal: Sixth month, Tian Qi, Bao Mu then with grand masters with troops entered duke palace, attacked Gao Zhao Zi.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixth month, Tian Qi and Bao Mu then with the grand masters entered the duke's palace with troops; attacked Gao Zhao Zi.

sentences.zh: 昭子聞之，與國惠子救公。

translations.literal: Zhao Zi heard it, with Guo Hui Zi saved duke.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Zi heard it; with Guo Hui Zi saved the duke.

sentences.zh: 公師敗，田乞之徒追之，國惠子奔莒，遂反殺高昭子。

translations.literal: Duke army defeated, Tian Qi followers pursued them, Guo Hui Zi fled Ju, then conversely killed Gao Zhao Zi.
translations.idiomatic: The duke's army was defeated; Tian Qi's followers pursued them; Guo Hui Zi fled to Ju; then they conversely killed Gao Zhao Zi.

sentences.zh: 晏圉奔魯。

translations.literal: Yan Yu fled Lu.
translations.idiomatic: Yan Yu fled to Lu.

sentences.zh: 八月，齊秉意茲。

translations.literal: Eighth month, Qi took Yi Zi.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighth month, Qi took Yi Zi.

sentences.zh: 田乞敗二相，乃使人之魯召公子陽生。

translations.literal: Tian Qi defeated two ministers, then sent people to Lu summoned duke son Yang Sheng.
translations.idiomatic: Tian Qi defeated the two ministers; then sent people to Lu to summon duke son Yang Sheng.

sentences.zh: 陽生至齊，私匿田乞家。

translations.literal: Yang Sheng arrived Qi, privately hid Tian Qi home.
translations.idiomatic: Yang Sheng arrived at Qi; privately hid at Tian Qi's home.

sentences.zh: 十月戊子，田乞請諸大夫曰：「常之母有魚菽之祭，幸來會飲。」

translations.literal: Tenth month Wu Zi, Tian Qi invited various grand masters said: 'Chang mother has fish bean sacrifice, fortunate come meet drink.'
translations.idiomatic: On the tenth month Wu Zi, Tian Qi invited the various grand masters: 'Chang's mother has a fish and bean sacrifice; fortunate to come meet and drink.'

sentences.zh: 會飲，田乞盛陽生橐中，置坐中央，發橐出陽生，曰：「此乃齊君矣！」

translations.literal: Met drank, Tian Qi filled Yang Sheng bag middle, placed seat central, opened bag exited Yang Sheng, said: 'this then Qi lord!'
translations.idiomatic: They met and drank; Tian Qi filled Yang Sheng in a bag; placed it in the seat's center; opened the bag and Yang Sheng exited; said: 'This is then the Qi lord!'

sentences.zh: 大夫皆伏謁。

translations.literal: Grand masters all prostrated greeted.
translations.idiomatic: The grand masters all prostrated and greeted.

sentences.zh: 將與大夫盟而立之，鮑牧醉，乞誣大夫曰：「吾與鮑牧謀共立陽生。」

translations.literal: About to with grand masters ally and establish him, Bao Mu drunk, Qi slandered grand masters said: 'I with Bao Mu plotted together establish Yang Sheng.'
translations.idiomatic: About to ally with the grand masters and establish him; Bao Mu was drunk; Qi slandered the grand masters: 'I plotted with Bao Mu to together establish Yang Sheng.'

sentences.zh: 鮑牧怒曰：「子忘景公之命乎？」

translations.literal: Bao Mu angered said: 'you forget Jing Gong command?'
translations.idiomatic: Bao Mu angered and said: 'Have you forgotten Jing Gong's command?'

sentences.zh: 諸大夫相視欲悔，陽生前，頓首曰：「可則立之，否則已。」

translations.literal: Various grand masters mutually looked wanted regret, Yang Sheng forward, knocked head said: 'can then establish him, not then stop.'
translations.idiomatic: The various grand masters looked at each other and wanted to regret; Yang Sheng came forward; knocked his head and said: 'If possible then establish him; if not then stop.'

sentences.zh: 鮑牧恐禍起，乃復曰：「皆景公子也，何為不可！」

translations.literal: Bao Mu feared calamity arise, then again said: 'all Jing Gong sons also, why not permissible!'
translations.idiomatic: Bao Mu feared calamity would arise; then again said: 'All are Jing Gong's sons; why not permissible!'

sentences.zh: 乃與盟，立陽生，是為悼公。

translations.literal: Then with allied, established Yang Sheng, this was Dao Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Then they allied; established Yang Sheng; this was Dao Gong.

sentences.zh: 悼公入宮，使人遷晏孺子於駘，殺之幕下，而逐孺子母芮子。

translations.literal: Dao Gong entered palace, made people move Yan Ru Zi to Dai, killed him tent below, and expelled Ru Zi mother Rui Zi.
translations.idiomatic: Dao Gong entered the palace; made people move Yan Ru Zi to Dai; killed him below the tent; and expelled Ru Zi's mother Rui Zi.

sentences.zh: 芮子故賤而孺子少，故無權，國人輕之。

translations.literal: Rui Zi originally base and Ru Zi young, therefore no power, state people slighted him.
translations.idiomatic: Rui Zi was originally base and Ru Zi young; therefore had no power; the state people slighted him.

sentences.zh: 悼公元年，齊伐魯，取讙、闡。

translations.literal: Dao Gong first year, Qi attacked Lu, took Huan, Chan.
translations.idiomatic: In Dao Gong's first year, Qi attacked Lu; took Huan and Chan.

sentences.zh: 初，陽生亡在魯，季康子以其妹妻之。

translations.literal: Initially, Yang Sheng fled in Lu, Ji Kang Zi with his younger sister married him.
translations.idiomatic: Initially, Yang Sheng fled to Lu; Ji Kang Zi married his younger sister to him.

sentences.zh: 及歸即位，使迎之。

translations.literal: And returned ascended throne, sent welcome her.
translations.idiomatic: When he returned and ascended the throne; sent to welcome her.

sentences.zh: 季姬與季魴侯通，言其情，魯弗敢與，故齊伐魯，竟迎季姬。

translations.literal: Ji Ji with Ji Fang Hou had relations, spoke their feelings, Lu not dared give, therefore Qi attacked Lu, finally welcomed Ji Ji.
translations.idiomatic: Ji Ji had relations with Ji Fang Hou; spoke their feelings; Lu did not dare give her; therefore Qi attacked Lu; finally welcomed Ji Ji.

sentences.zh: 季姬嬖，齊復歸魯侵地。

translations.literal: Ji Ji favored, Qi again returned Lu invaded lands.
translations.idiomatic: Ji Ji was favored; Qi again returned Lu's invaded lands.

sentences.zh: 鮑子與悼公有郤，不善。

translations.literal: Bao Zi with Dao Gong had enmity, not good.
translations.idiomatic: Bao Zi had enmity with Dao Gong; not good.

sentences.zh: 四年，吳、魯伐齊南方。

translations.literal: Fourth year, Wu, Lu attacked Qi southern.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth year, Wu and Lu attacked Qi's southern areas.

sentences.zh: 鮑子弒悼公，赴于吳。

translations.literal: Bao Zi assassinated Dao Gong, fled to Wu.
translations.idiomatic: Bao Zi assassinated Dao Gong; fled to Wu.

sentences.zh: 吳王夫差哭於軍門外三日，將從海入討齊。

translations.literal: Wu king Fu Chai cried army gate outside three days, about to from sea enter punish Qi.
translations.idiomatic: Wu king Fu Chai cried outside the army gate for three days; about to enter from the sea to punish Qi.

sentences.zh: 齊人敗之，吳師乃去。

translations.literal: Qi people defeated them, Wu troops then left.
translations.idiomatic: Qi people defeated them; Wu troops then left.

sentences.zh: 晉趙鞅伐齊，至賴而去。

translations.literal: Jin Zhao Yang attacked Qi, arrived Lai and left.
translations.idiomatic: Jin Zhao Yang attacked Qi; arrived at Lai and left.

sentences.zh: 齊人共立悼公子壬，是為簡公。

translations.literal: Qi people together established Dao Gong son Ren, this was Jian Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Qi people together established Dao Gong's son Ren; this was Jian Gong.

sentences.zh: 簡公四年春，初，簡公與父陽生俱在魯也，監止有寵焉。

translations.literal: Jian Gong fourth year spring, initially, Jian Gong with father Yang Sheng both in Lu also, Jian Zhi had favor there.
translations.idiomatic: In Jian Gong's fourth year spring, initially, Jian Gong and his father Yang Sheng were both in Lu; Jian Zhi had favor there.

sentences.zh: 及即位，使為政。

translations.literal: And ascended throne, made administer government.
translations.idiomatic: When he ascended the throne; made him administer the government.

sentences.zh: 田成子憚之，驟顧於朝。

translations.literal: Tian Cheng Zi feared him, frequently looked back in court.
translations.idiomatic: Tian Cheng Zi feared him; frequently looked back in court.

sentences.zh: 御鞅言簡公曰：「田、監不可并也，君其擇焉。」

translations.literal: Yu Yang spoke Jian Gong said: 'Tian, Jian cannot together also, lord choose among them.'
translations.idiomatic: Yu Yang spoke to Jian Gong: 'Tian and Jian cannot be together; my lord should choose among them.'

sentences.zh: 弗聽。

translations.literal: Not listened.
translations.idiomatic: He did not listen.

sentences.zh: 子我夕，田逆殺人，逢之，遂捕以入。

translations.literal: Zi Wo evening, Tian Ni killed person, met him, then seized and entered.
translations.idiomatic: Zi Wo in the evening; Tian Ni killed a person; met him; then seized and entered.

sentences.zh: 田氏方睦，使囚病而遺守囚者酒，醉而殺守者，得亡。

translations.literal: Tian clan just harmonious, made prisoner ill and sent guard prisoner wine, drunk and killed guard, got escape.
translations.idiomatic: The Tian clan was just harmonious; made the prisoner feign illness and sent wine to the guard of prisoners; drunk and killed the guard; got away.

sentences.zh: 子我盟諸田於陳宗。

translations.literal: Zi Wo allied various Tian at Chen Zong.
translations.idiomatic: Zi Wo allied the various Tian at Chen Zong.

sentences.zh: 初，田豹欲為子我臣，使公孫言豹，豹有喪而止。

translations.literal: Initially, Tian Bao wanted be Zi Wo minister, made Gong Sun speak Bao, Bao had mourning and stopped.
translations.idiomatic: Initially, Tian Bao wanted to be Zi Wo's minister; made Gong Sun speak to Bao; Bao had mourning and stopped.

sentences.zh: 後卒以為臣，幸於子我。

translations.literal: Later finally became minister, fortunate with Zi Wo.
translations.idiomatic: Later he finally became a minister; fortunate with Zi Wo.

sentences.zh: 子我謂曰：「吾盡逐田氏而立女，可乎？」

translations.literal: Zi Wo told said: 'I completely expel Tian clan and establish you, permissible?'
translations.idiomatic: Zi Wo told him: 'I will completely expel the Tian clan and establish you; is this permissible?'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「我遠田氏矣。

translations.literal: Replied said: 'I distant Tian clan.'
translations.idiomatic: He replied: 'I am distant from the Tian clan.'

sentences.zh: 且其違者不過數人，何盡逐焉！」

translations.literal: Moreover those violating not exceed several people, why completely expel!'
translations.idiomatic: Moreover, those violating do not exceed several people; why completely expel them!'

sentences.zh: 遂告田氏。

translations.literal: Then told Tian clan.
translations.idiomatic: Then he told the Tian clan.

sentences.zh: 子行曰：「彼得君，弗先，必禍子。」

translations.literal: Zi Xing said: 'he gets lord, not first, certainly calamity you.'
translations.idiomatic: Zi Xing said: 'He gets the lord; not first; certainly calamity for you.'

sentences.zh: 子行舍於公宮。

translations.literal: Zi Xing resided in duke palace.
translations.idiomatic: Zi Xing resided in the duke's palace.

sentences.zh: 夏五月壬申，成子兄弟四乘如公。

translations.literal: Summer fifth month Ren Shen, Cheng Zi brothers four chariots went to duke.
translations.idiomatic: In summer fifth month Ren Shen, Cheng Zi's brothers went to the duke in four chariots.

sentences.zh: 子我在幄，出迎之，遂入，閉門。

translations.literal: Zi Wo in tent, exited welcomed them, then entered, closed door.
translations.idiomatic: Zi Wo was in the tent; exited and welcomed them; then entered; closed the door.

sentences.zh: 宦者御之，子行殺宦者。

translations.literal: Eunuch drove, Zi Xing killed eunuch.
translations.idiomatic: The eunuch drove; Zi Xing killed the eunuch.

sentences.zh: 公與婦人飲酒於檀臺，成子遷諸寢。

translations.literal: Duke with woman drank wine at Tan platform, Cheng Zi moved various to chambers.
translations.idiomatic: The duke drank wine with a woman at Tan platform; Cheng Zi moved various to the chambers.

sentences.zh: 公執戈將擊之，太史子餘曰：「非不利也，將除害也。」

translations.literal: Duke grasped spear about to strike him, grand scribe Zi Yu said: 'not disadvantage also, about to remove harm.'
translations.idiomatic: The duke grasped a spear about to strike him; grand scribe Zi Yu said: 'It is not disadvantage; about to remove harm.'

sentences.zh: 成子出舍于庫，聞公猶怒，將出，曰：「何所無君！」

translations.literal: Cheng Zi exited resided in storehouse, heard duke still angry, about to exit, said: 'what place without lord!'
translations.idiomatic: Cheng Zi exited and resided in the storehouse; heard the duke was still angry; about to exit; said: 'What place without a lord!'

sentences.zh: 子行拔劍曰：「需，事之賊也。

translations.literal: Zi Xing drew sword said: 'delay, affairs thief.'
translations.idiomatic: Zi Xing drew his sword and said: 'Delay is the thief of affairs.'

sentences.zh: 誰非田宗？

translations.literal: Who not Tian ancestor?
translations.idiomatic: Who is not of the Tian ancestor?

sentences.zh: 所不殺子者有如田宗。」

translations.literal: What not kill you like Tian ancestor.'
translations.idiomatic: What does not kill you is like the Tian ancestor.'

sentences.zh: 乃止。

translations.literal: Then stopped.
translations.idiomatic: Then he stopped.

sentences.zh: 子我歸，屬徒攻闈與大門，皆弗勝，乃出。

translations.literal: Zi Wo returned, gathered followers attacked inner gate and great gate, all not victorious, then exited.
translations.idiomatic: Zi Wo returned; gathered followers to attack the inner gate and great gate; all not victorious; then exited.

sentences.zh: 田氏追之。

translations.literal: Tian clan pursued him.
translations.idiomatic: The Tian clan pursued him.

sentences.zh: 豐丘人執子我以告，殺之郭關。

translations.literal: Feng Qiu people seized Zi Wo to report, killed him outer gate.
translations.idiomatic: Feng Qiu people seized Zi Wo to report; killed him at the outer gate.

sentences.zh: 成子將殺大陸子方，田逆請而免之。

translations.literal: Cheng Zi about to kill Da Lu Zi Fang, Tian Ni requested and exempted him.
translations.idiomatic: Cheng Zi was about to kill Da Lu Zi Fang; Tian Ni requested and exempted him.

sentences.zh: 以公命取車於道，出雍門。

translations.literal: With duke command took chariot on road, exited Yong gate.
translations.idiomatic: With the duke's command he took a chariot on the road; exited Yong gate.

sentences.zh: 田豹與之車，弗受，曰：「逆為余請，豹與余車，余有私焉。

translations.literal: Tian Bao gave him chariot, not accepted, said: 'Ni for me requested, Bao gave me chariot, I have private there.'
translations.idiomatic: Tian Bao gave him a chariot; not accepted; said: 'Ni requested for me; Bao gave me a chariot; I have private there.'

sentences.zh: 事子我而有私於其讎，何以見魯、衛之士？」

translations.literal: Served Zi Wo and had private with his enemy, how see Lu, Wei gentlemen?'
translations.idiomatic: Served Zi Wo and had private dealings with his enemy; how to see Lu and Wei gentlemen?'

sentences.zh: 庚辰，田常執簡公于俆州。

translations.literal: Geng Chen, Tian Chang seized Jian Gong at Xu Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: On Geng Chen, Tian Chang seized Jian Gong at Xu Zhou.

sentences.zh: 公曰：「余蚤從御鞅言，不及此。」

translations.literal: Duke said: 'I early followed Yu Yang words, not reach this.'
translations.idiomatic: The duke said: 'I early followed Yu Yang's words; did not reach this.'

sentences.zh: 甲午，田常弒簡公于俆州。

translations.literal: Jia Wu, Tian Chang assassinated Jian Gong at Xu Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: On Jia Wu, Tian Chang assassinated Jian Gong at Xu Zhou.

sentences.zh: 田常乃立簡公弟驁，是為平公。

translations.literal: Tian Chang then established Jian Gong younger brother Ao, this was Ping Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Tian Chang then established Jian Gong's younger brother Ao; this was Ping Gong.

sentences.zh: 平公即位，田常相之，專齊之政，割齊安平以東為田氏封邑。

translations.literal: Ping Gong ascended throne, Tian Chang assisted him, monopolized Qi government, divided Qi An Ping east as Tian clan enfeoffed city.
translations.idiomatic: Ping Gong ascended the throne; Tian Chang assisted him; monopolized Qi's government; divided Qi's An Ping eastward as Tian clan's enfeoffed city.

sentences.zh: 平公八年，越滅吳。

translations.literal: Ping Gong eighth year, Yue extinguished Wu.
translations.idiomatic: In Ping Gong's eighth year, Yue extinguished Wu.

sentences.zh: 二十五年卒，子宣公積立。

translations.literal: Twenty-fifth year died, son Xuan Gong Ji established.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-fifth year he died; his son Xuan Gong Ji was established.

sentences.zh: 宣公五十一年卒，子康公貸立。

translations.literal: Xuan Gong fifty-first year died, son Kang Gong Dai established.
translations.idiomatic: In Xuan Gong's fifty-first year he died; his son Kang Gong Dai was established.

sentences.zh: 田會反廩丘。

translations.literal: Tian Hui rebelled Lin Qiu.
translations.idiomatic: Tian Hui rebelled at Lin Qiu.

sentences.zh: 康公二年，韓、魏、趙始列為諸侯。

translations.literal: Kang Gong second year, Han, Wei, Zhao began ranked as feudal lords.
translations.idiomatic: In Kang Gong's second year, Han, Wei, and Zhao began to be ranked as feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 十九年，田常曾孫田和始為諸侯，遷康公海濱。

translations.literal: Nineteenth year, Tian Chang great-grandson Tian He began as feudal lord, moved Kang Gong seashore.
translations.idiomatic: In the nineteenth year, Tian Chang's great-grandson Tian He began as a feudal lord; moved Kang Gong to the seashore.

sentences.zh: 二十六年，康公卒，呂氏遂絕其祀。

translations.literal: Twenty-sixth year, Kang Gong died, Lü clan then extinguished his sacrifices.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-sixth year, Kang Gong died; the Lü clan then extinguished his sacrifices.

sentences.zh: 田氏卒有齊國，為齊威王，彊於天下。

translations.literal: Tian clan finally possessed Qi state, became Qi Wei Wang, strong in the world.
translations.idiomatic: The Tian clan finally possessed the Qi state; became Qi Wei Wang; strong in the world.

sentences.zh: 太史公曰：吾適齊，自泰山屬之瑯邪，北被于海，膏壤二千里，其民闊達多匿知，其天性也。

translations.literal: Grand scribe said: I went to Qi, from Tai Shan connected to Lang Ya, north covered by sea, fertile soil two thousand li, its people broad-minded much hidden knowledge, its natural nature.
translations.idiomatic: The Grand Scribe said: I went to Qi; from Tai Shan it connects to Lang Ya; north it is covered by the sea; fertile soil two thousand li; its people are broad-minded and have much hidden knowledge; it is their natural nature.

sentences.zh: 以太公之聖，建國本，桓公之盛，修善政，以為諸侯會盟，稱伯，不亦宜乎？

translations.literal: With Tai Gong wisdom, established state foundation, Huan Gong flourishing, repaired good government, became feudal lords assembly alliance, called hegemon, not also fitting?
translations.idiomatic: With Tai Gong's wisdom, established the state's foundation; with Huan Gong's flourishing, repaired good government; became the feudal lords' assembly and alliance; called hegemon; was it not also fitting?

sentences.zh: 洋洋哉，固大國之風也！

translations.literal: Broad broad, indeed great state wind!
translations.idiomatic: How broad it is; indeed the great state's style!
